ArmorHead.Armor_001_Head_Desc:
A hood woven using traditional Hyrulean 
methods. It's made from a sturdy material
to protect travelers from the harsh
sun and weather.

A hood woven using traditional Hyrulean
methods, made from sturdy material.
A Great Fairy has increased its defense
by one level.

A hood woven using traditional Hyrulean
methods, made from sturdy material.

ArmorHead.Armor_005_Head_Desc:
According to legend, this cap was crafted for
a hero who travels the wild lands. Wearing it
just feels so right.

ArmorHead.Armor_008_Head_Desc:
Gerudo-made armor for males sold rarely by
Gerudo retailers. It contains sapphire, a gem
that harnesses the power of ice to make the
heat more bearable.
ArmorHead.Armor_009_Head_Desc:
A Rito accessory made from snow-bird
feathers. It's adorned with a ruby, a gem
that harnesses the power of fire to make
cold climates more tolerable.
ArmorHead.Armor_011_Head_Desc:
Stone headgear made by Goron craftsmen
to protect tourists visiting Goron City. As if its
flame resistance isn't enough of a selling
point, it also covers your entire head!
ArmorHead.Armor_012_Head_Desc:
It may look like a regular cloth mask, but it
was made using Sheikah crafting techniques
to suppress the noisy rustling of clothes.
Perfect for sneaking about.
ArmorHead.Armor_014_Head_Desc:
It may look like a regular bandanna, but it's
actually infused with ancient technology that
enhances core strength to improve your
climbing ability.
ArmorHead.Armor_015_Head_Desc:
A hood woven using traditional Hyrulean
methods, made from sturdy material.
A Great Fairy has increased its defense
to the maximum level.
ArmorHead.Armor_017_Head_Desc:
A special mask for members of the Gerudo
Secret Club. Painted with dye made from
crushed luminous stones, it gives off a lurid,
mysterious glow in the dark.
ArmorHead.Armor_020_Head_Desc:
Headgear made from sturdy metals for
frontline soldiers. Praised for their defensive
capabilities, the only helms that remain are
those that survived the Calamity.
ArmorHead.Armor_021_Head_Desc:
This headgear is the result of Robbie's
research. It uses Guardian parts to decrease
damage from ancient energy attacks.
ArmorHead.Armor_022_Head_Desc:
Kilton's handmade Bokoblin headgear. It's
almost charming in a cute, monstrous kind of
way... Equip it to blend in with Bokoblins.
ArmorHead.Armor_024_Head_Desc:
A luxurious headpiece sold at Gerudo
jewelry shops. It's decorated with a diamond,
which harnesses the power of light to reduce
damage received from ancient enemies.
ArmorHead.Armor_025_Head_Desc:
A headpiece made by Gerudo craft workers.
It's set with a ruby, a gem that harnesses
the power of fire to make cold climates
more bearable.
ArmorHead.Armor_026_Head_Desc:
An intricate headpiece crafted with Gerudo
goldsmith techniques. It's set with a
sapphire, a gem that harnesses the power
of ice to make hot climates more tolerable.
ArmorHead.Armor_027_Head_Desc:
Earrings made by Gerudo craft workers.
They're made with topaz, a gem that
harnesses the power of lightning to increase
electricity resistance.
ArmorHead.Armor_028_Head_Desc:
Earrings sold at Gerudo jewelry shops.
They contain opal, a gem that harnesses
the power of water to increase your
swimming speed.
ArmorHead.Armor_029_Head_Desc:
One of the items sold by the Gerudo jeweler.
These earrings are made with amber, a gem
that harnesses the power of the land to
increase defense when equipped.

Wearing it draws out your inner animal,

Kilton's handmade Lizalfos headgear. It's
designed to replicate the unique tongue and

ArmorHead.Armor_056_Head_Desc:
Kilton's handmade Lynel headgear. It's so
well crafted, it can deceive a real Lynel.
Equip it to blend in with Lynels, but don't
linger too long. Those beasts are smart.

terrorized brave heroes. This helmet looks
just like the ones they supposedly wore.

An eerie mask passed down from ancient
times. Wearing it makes it harder for certain
enemies to spot you. It's a rather rare find.

she fought alongside the Hero of Twilight.
It's a rather rare find.
ArmorHead.Armor_174_Head_Desc:

this hood, and so will you. After all, it's a
rather rare find. Kooloo-Limpah!

It shakes when one is hiding nearby.
It's a rather rare find.
ArmorHead.Armor_177_Head_Desc:

ArmorHead.Armor_178_Head_Desc:

quite comfortable, and their high durability

said they're crafted using dragon scales.

Gerudo-made trousers for men sold rarely

their creation, which harnesses the power
of ice to make the heat more tolerable.

The Rito sell these trousers to Hylians

Rito feathers, so they excel at retaining

Goron artisans used flame-resistant rocks to

Members of the Sheikah tribe wear these

They're made from noise-suppressing cloth,

These rock-climbing boots have special
no-slip toes that help you cling to walls.
This ancient technology facilitates more

These trousers are common throughout the
Hyrule region. The soft fabric makes them
quite comfortable. A Great Fairy increased
their defense to the maximum level.

These tights are sold in the Gerudo Secret

luminous stones, which gives them an eerie

Hyrulean guards favored these greaves.
They owe their distinctly high defense to
the metal plates they're made from, but the
added weight takes some getting used to.

Robbie engineered these greaves at the

found in Guardian automata. They reduce
damage from ancient weaponry.

ArmorUpper.Armor_011_Upper_Desc:
Armor crafted by Gorons for Hylians curious
enough to visit Goron City. It's made from
fire-resistant rocks to protect the wearer.
ArmorUpper.Armor_012_Upper_Desc:
Armor designed for stealth, passed down
through the Sheikah tribe. The special fabrics
suppress the rustling of clothes even when

ArmorUpper.Armor_014_Upper_Desc:
The ancient technology in this gear will
make you a better climber. The special
no-slip gloves help you use your energy
more efficiently to facilitate nimble climbing.
ArmorUpper.Armor_015_Upper_Desc:
A common garb popular in Hyrule, especially
among travelers. Its light-yet-sturdy fabric
doesn't limit movement. A Great Fairy
increased its defense to its maximum level.
ArmorUpper.Armor_017_Upper_Desc:
This shirt is sold at the Gerudo Secret Club.
It glows with a strange pattern in the dark
due to a dye made from crushed luminous
stones.
ArmorUpper.Armor_020_Upper_Desc:
Hyrulean guards praised this armor for its
superior defense. Made from sturdy plates of
metal, the high level of craftsmanship that 
went into it is obvious with just a glance.
ArmorUpper.Armor_021_Upper_Desc:
This armor was created by ancient Sheikah
technology using Guardian parts. Equipping
it will reduce the damage you take from
ancient weaponry.
ArmorUpper.Armor_035_Upper_Desc:
This armor was apparently crafted for a hero
who travels the wilds. Strangely enough,
it's just your size. A Great Fairy has
increased its defense by one level.
ArmorUpper.Armor_036_Upper_Desc:
Made by Rito artisans, this tunic stacks
molted Rito feathers in each layer to help
retain body heat. A Great Fairy has
increased its defense by one level.

Bullet.AncientArrow_Desc:
An arrow created using ancient technology.
To be struck with one is to be consigned to
oblivion in an instant. It deals devastating
damageeven against Guardians.
Bullet.AncientArrow_PictureBook:
An arrow created using ancient technology.
To be struck with one is to be consigned to
oblivion in an instant. It deals devastating
damageeven against Guardians.
Bullet.AncientArrow_Spec: The ancient arrowhead deals massive damage.
Bullet.BombArrow_A_Desc:
A powerful arrow designed to destroy
monsters. The explosive powder packed into
the tip ignites on impact, dealing massive
damage to anything caught in the blast.
Bullet.BombArrow_A_PictureBook:
A powerful arrow designed to destroy
monsters. The explosive powder packed into
the tip ignites on impact, dealing massive
damage to anything caught in the blast.
Bullet.BombArrow_A_Spec: Explodes on impact, dealing massive damage.
Bullet.ElectricArrow_Desc:
An arrow imbued with the power of electricity.
It breaks apart on impact, channeling
electricity into nearby objects. It's incredibly
effective against metal or anything wet.
Bullet.ElectricArrow_PictureBook:
An arrow imbued with the power of electricity.
It breaks apart on impact, channeling
electricity into nearby objects. It's incredibly
effective against metal or anything wet.
Bullet.FireArrow_Desc:
An arrow imbued with the power of fire.
It breaks apart on impact, igniting objects in
the immediate area. It's incredibly effective
against cold things.
Bullet.FireArrow_PictureBook:
An arrow imbued with the power of fire.
It breaks apart on impact, igniting objects in
the immediate area. It's incredibly effective
against cold things.
Bullet.FireArrow_Spec: Ignites flammable targets, causing extra damage.
Bullet.IceArrow_Desc:
An arrow imbued with the power of ice.
It breaks apart on impact, freezing
objects in the immediate area. It's
incredibly effective against hot things.
Bullet.IceArrow_PictureBook:
An arrow imbued with the power of ice.
It breaks apart on impact, freezing
objects in the immediate area. It's
incredibly effective against hot things.
Bullet.NormalArrow_Desc:
A common arrow. Its shaft was carved from
the wood of a sturdy tree.
Bullet.NormalArrow_PictureBook:
A common arrow. Its shaft was carved from
the wood of a sturdy tree.

CapturedActor.Animal_Insect_AA_Desc:
This valuable beetle can live up to ten
years. When cooked with monster parts,
its impressive vitality translates into an
elixir that will greatly restore your stamina.
CapturedActor.Animal_Insect_AA_PictureBook:
This valuable beetle can live up to ten
years. When cooked with monster parts,
its impressive vitality translates into an
elixir that will greatly restore your stamina.
CapturedActor.Animal_Insect_AB_Desc:
This rare butterfly lives in volcanic regions.
Its body contains a heat-resistant liquid,
which can be turned into a topical elixir
that offers resistance to flames.
CapturedActor.Animal_Insect_AB_PictureBook:
This rare butterfly lives in volcanic regions.
Its body contains a heat-resistant liquid,
which can be turned into a topical elixir
that offers resistance to flames.
CapturedActor.Animal_Insect_A_Desc:
A quick frog that can be found
hopping around near water. Cook it with
monster parts to draw out its speed-boost
effect.
CapturedActor.Animal_Insect_A_PictureBook:
A quick frog that can be found
hopping around near water. Cook it with
monster parts to draw out its speed-boost
effect.
CapturedActor.Animal_Insect_B_Desc:
This rare frog only ventures out in the rain.
When cooked with monster parts, the elixir
it produces will temporarily increase your
maximum stamina.
CapturedActor.Animal_Insect_B_PictureBook:
This rare frog only ventures out in the rain.
When cooked with monster parts, the elixir
it produces will temporarily increase your
maximum stamina.
CapturedActor.Animal_Insect_C_Desc:
This dragonfly prefers the cool shade of
trees to the warmth of the sun. Its wings
disperse heat from its body, which can be
cooked into a heat-resistance elixir.
CapturedActor.Animal_Insect_C_PictureBook:
This dragonfly prefers the cool shade of
trees to the warmth of the sun. Its wings
disperse heat from its body, which can be
cooked into a heat-resistance elixir.
CapturedActor.Animal_Insect_E_Desc:
These fireflies glow gently in the dark. When
cooked with monster parts, the compound
that causes it to glow results in an elixir that
will allow you to move more quietly.
CapturedActor.Animal_Insect_E_PictureBook:
These fireflies glow gently in the dark. When
cooked with monster parts, the compound
that causes it to glow results in an elixir that
will allow you to move more quietly.
CapturedActor.Animal_Insect_F_Desc:
This fairy will fly from your pouch and heal all
your wounds the moment you lose your last
heart. It's easily mistaken for a firefly at first,
but it glows in the daylight as well as night.
CapturedActor.Animal_Insect_F_PictureBook:
This fairy will fly from your pouch and heal all
your wounds the moment you lose your last
heart. It's easily mistaken for a firefly at first,
but it glows in the daylight as well as night.
CapturedActor.Animal_Insect_G_Desc:
This beetle's razor-sharp horns demand that
you handle it with care. Boil the horns
alongside monster parts to concoct an elixir
that will raise your attack power.
CapturedActor.Animal_Insect_G_PictureBook:
This beetle's razor-sharp horns demand that
you handle it with care. Boil the horns
alongside monster parts to concoct an elixir
that will raise your attack power.
CapturedActor.Animal_Insect_H_Desc:
A very energetic cricket.
Cook it with monster parts to create
a stamina-recovery elixir.
CapturedActor.Animal_Insect_H_PictureBook:
A very energetic cricket.
Cook it with monster parts to create
a stamina-recovery elixir.
CapturedActor.Animal_Insect_I_Desc:
This rare dragonfly only appears in the rain.
Its wings direct electricity away from its body.
Cook it with monster parts for an electricity-
resistance elixir.
CapturedActor.Animal_Insect_I_PictureBook:
This rare dragonfly only appears in the rain.
Its wings direct electricity away from its body.
Cook it with monster parts for an electricity-
resistance elixir.
CapturedActor.Animal_Insect_M_Desc:
This rare lizard lives deep in the forests. It
feeds on high-nutrient foods, giving it great
vitality. When used to make elixirs, they
temporarily increase your maximum hearts.
CapturedActor.Animal_Insect_M_PictureBook:
This rare lizard lives deep in the forests. It
feeds on high-nutrient foods, giving it great
vitality. When used to make elixirs, they
temporarily increase your maximum hearts.
CapturedActor.Animal_Insect_N_Desc:
The powdery scales of this butterfly's wings
cool the air around it. Watching it flutter
around snowflakes is a thing of beauty. Cook
it with monster parts for a heat-resistant elixir.

The powdery scales of this butterfly's wings

When the shell is cooked with monster parts,
the resulting elixir boosts your defense.
CapturedActor.Animal_Insect_P_PictureBook:
This beetle's hard body resembles armor.
When the shell is cooked with monster parts,
the resulting elixir boosts your defense.
CapturedActor.Animal_Insect_Q_Desc:
A butterfly found in the woods and plains of
warm regions. Its wings absorb the warmth of
the sun. Cook it with monster parts to create
an elixir that makes you feel warm and fuzzy.
CapturedActor.Animal_Insect_Q_PictureBook:
A butterfly found in the woods and plains of
warm regions. Its wings absorb the warmth of
the sun. Cook it with monster parts to create
an elixir that makes you feel warm and fuzzy.
CapturedActor.Animal_Insect_R_Desc:
This rare butterfly only shows itself when it
rains. The organs in its body produce an
insulating compound. When made into
an elixir, it offers electrical resistance.
CapturedActor.Animal_Insect_R_PictureBook:
This rare butterfly only shows itself when it
rains. The organs in its body produce an
insulating compound. When made into
an elixir, it offers electrical resistance.
CapturedActor.Animal_Insect_S_Desc:
A lizard found throughout Hyrule. It's a bit
slow to react at times, but if given a chance
to escape, it will dart off quickly. Cook it with
monster parts for a speed-boosting elixir.
CapturedActor.Animal_Insect_S_PictureBook:
A lizard found throughout Hyrule. It's a bit
slow to react at times, but if given a chance
to escape, it will dart off quickly. Cook it with
monster parts for a speed-boosting elixir.
CapturedActor.Animal_Insect_T_Desc:
This dragonfly has a special organ that
causes it to sweat profusely. Cook it with
monster parts for an elixir that will raise your
core temperature so you can resist the cold.
CapturedActor.Animal_Insect_T_PictureBook:
This dragonfly has a special organ that
causes it to sweat profusely. Cook it with
monster parts for an elixir that will raise your
core temperature so you can resist the cold.
CapturedActor.Animal_Insect_X_Desc:
This rare lizard can only be found in the
Eldin region. Its scales have heat-resistant
properties, so when cooked with monster
parts, it produces a heat-resistance elixir.
CapturedActor.Animal_Insect_X_PictureBook:
This rare lizard can only be found in the
Eldin region. Its scales have heat-resistant
properties, so when cooked with monster
parts, it produces a heat-resistance elixir.
CapturedActor.BeeHome_Desc:
Honey straight from the hive is chock-full of
nutrients. Cooking this into a meal unlocks
the potential of these nutrients and provides
a stamina-recovery effect.
CapturedActor.BeeHome_PictureBook:
Honey straight from the hive is chock-full of
nutrients. Cooking this into a meal unlocks
the potential of these nutrients and provides
a stamina-recovery effect.

Dragon.Enemy_Dragon_Electric_PictureBook:
A spirit of lightning has taken the form of this
giant dragon. Making its home in the Faron
region, it's said to have served the Spring of
Courage since ancient times. An old saying
goes, "The dragon ascends to the heavens as
the sun begins to set," but nobody has seen
this in the current age. The electricity that
coats its body makes it dangerous to get near,
but Farosh bears no ill will toward people.
Dragon.Enemy_Dragon_Fire_PictureBook:
A spirit of fire has taken the form of this giant
dragon. Making its home in the Eldin region,
it's said to have served the Spring of Power
since ancient times. An old saying goes, "The
dragon ascends to the heavens as the sun
begins to set," but nobody has witnessed this
in the current age. The flames that coat its
body make it dangerous to get near, but
Dinraal bears no ill will toward people.
Dragon.Enemy_Dragon_Ice_PictureBook:
A spirit of ice has taken the form of this giant
dragon. Making its home in the Lanayru
region, it's said to have served the Spring of
Wisdom since ancient times. An old saying
goes, "The dragon ascends to the heavens as
the sun begins to set," but nobody has seen
this in the current age. The ice that coats its
body makes it dangerous to get near, but
Naydra bears no ill will toward people.

Enemy.Enemy_AirOctarock_PictureBook:
These low-level, octopus-like monsters used
to be aquatic, but their inflatable air sacs
evolved so that they are able to float around
in the air. Other monsters are known to take
advantage of this ability, using them to make
floating fortresses. They are trained to ascend
when they hear a whistle, but they will
not attack.
Enemy.Enemy_Assassin_Junior_PictureBook:
The lowest-ranked members of the Yiga Clan.
They've been dispatched all across Hyrule
with a single task: seek out Link and end
his life. They're a crafty bunch, sometimes
disguising themselves as simple travelers
or villagers to get the jump on you. Be
wary of suspicious people you encounter.
They're very agile and carry a bow and a
one-handed sword.
Enemy.Enemy_Assassin_Middle_PictureBook:
These are the elite soldiers of the Yiga Clan.
They favor the windcleaver blade and are
extremely agile despite their bulky build.
At this Yiga Clan rank, they have mastered a
technique that allows them to manipulate the
very earth. By striking the ground, they can
create stone pillars and blasts of air.
Enemy.Enemy_Assassin_Senior_PictureBook:
The leader of the Yiga Clan, a group formed
with just a single objective: eliminate Link. He
sends his minions all over Hyrule in search of
you but tends to spend most of his own time
napping and generally loafing about. Despite
this, his mastery of the esoteric arts has
earned him a deep respect. Even if he
were to die, his followers would never
give up their one and only task.
Enemy.Enemy_Bokoblin_Bone_Junior_PictureBook:
The remains of Bokoblins appear in the dark
of the night. While they're fragile enough to
crumble from a single blow, as long as a
skull remains intact, they'll continue to pull
themselves back together and go on
fighting. Sometimes the body will pick up
the wrong skull, but this doesn't seem to
be a problem...
Enemy.Enemy_Bokoblin_Dark_PictureBook:
You would be foolish to call these Silver
Bokoblins a mere nuisance. They have
been influenced by Ganon's fiendish
magic, so they are stronger than even the
Black Bokoblins. They're called "silver"
not only because of their coloring but
also to denote their rarity. The purple
markings help them stand out even more.
Enemy.Enemy_Bokoblin_Gold_PictureBook:
With brutal strength and extreme resilience,
this type of Bokoblin somehow surpasses
Silver Bokoblins in sheer power. It is said they
are actually Silver Bokoblins who mysteriously
transformed after being struck by lightning.
Perhaps that is why they have such a high
tolerance for electric attacks.
Enemy.Enemy_Bokoblin_Junior_PictureBook:
This common species is a nuisance all
over Hyrule. Some have unified in the time
following the Great Calamity and have formed
factions of bandits. While not very clever,
they are at least intelligent enough to hunt
beasts and grill the meat for food. Though
they're typically ferocious carnivores, they
actually enjoy fruit as well.
Enemy.Enemy_Bokoblin_Middle_PictureBook:
This common species is a nuisance all
over Hyrule. They're tougher and have
stronger weapons than the red Bokoblins
and are a little more clever, as well. At the
very least, they figured out that they can
simply kick a Remote Bomb out of the way
to avoid its blast.
Enemy.Enemy_Bokoblin_Senior_PictureBook:
Although Bokoblins are generally a nuisance,
the Black Bokoblins are among the most
dangerous type. They're extremely resilient,
and many are armed with advanced weapons.
Enemy.Enemy_GanonBeast_PictureBook:
After Ganon was defeated by Link, the
remaining Malice pulled itself together to
form this bestial creature. Its appearance
and fiendish magic earned it the name of
Dark Beast. This form is considered to be
Ganon's original, although in this state, his
awareness has been consumed entirely
by Malice, and all he knows is a desire to
rampage and destroy.
Enemy.Enemy_GanonGrudge_01_PictureBook:
The Malice has given these Moblin skulls a
pitiful life after death. The only fragment of
their former selves they've held on to is the
ferocity innate to all Moblins, so they will
attack anyone that approaches. They're
tougher than Bokoblin skulls.
Enemy.Enemy_GanonGrudge_02_PictureBook:
The Malice has given these Lizalfos skulls a
sorry form of life after death. Only the slyness
of their former selves remains, making them
faster than Bokoblin skulls. They thoughtlessly
attack anyone who approaches.
Enemy.Enemy_GanonGrudge_PictureBook:
The Malice has given these Bokoblin skulls
a sort of life. Devoid of any intelligence the
Bokoblin it once belonged to may have had,
these pitiful things now exist only to attack
anything that gets too close.
Enemy.Enemy_Golem_Little_Fire_PictureBook:
A very young Igneo Talus. Their bodies
toughen as they mature and convert
fully into lava by adulthood. As a child,
however, while still covered in fire, their
bodies are fragile and light enough to
be blown away by a bomb's blast.
Enemy.Enemy_Golem_Little_Ice_PictureBook:
A very young Frost Talus. Their bodies
toughen and frost over as they mature,
becoming entirely made of ice by
adulthood. As a child, however, their
bodies are awfully fragile and are
light enough to be blown away by
a bomb's blast.
Enemy.Enemy_Golem_Little_PictureBook:
A very young Stone Talus. Their bodies
toughen as they mature, becoming as
tough as boulders by adulthood. As a
child, however, their bodies are light
enough to be lifted and fragile enough
to break when thrown.
Enemy.Enemy_Guardian_Mini_Baby_PictureBook:
Guardians were originally designed by an
ancient civilization to combat Ganon, but
these smaller models were placed inside
shrines as part of the trials found within.
The multiple legs and beam functionality
were scaled down but kept mostly intact.
Enemy.Enemy_Guardian_Mini_Junior_PictureBook:
Although originally designed by an ancient
civilization to combat Ganon, these scaled-
down Guardians were placed inside shrines
as part of the trials. In addition to the beam
functionality, this particular model was
designed to handle weaponry as a means
of further testing the combat prowess of one
undertaking the trials. It takes some serious
skill to go toe-to-toe with one of these.
Enemy.Enemy_Guardian_Mini_Middle_PictureBook:
Although originally designed by an ancient
civilization to combat Ganon, these scaled-
down Guardians were placed inside shrines
as part of the trials. This model is equipped
with twin-blade functionality to further test the
combat prowess of one undertaking the trials.
It takes a nimble fighter to overcome this one.
Enemy.Enemy_Guardian_Mini_Senior_PictureBook:
An ancient civilization originally designed
Guardians to combat Ganon but then scaled
them down to place in shrines as part of the
trials. This model is very resilient and has been
outfitted with triple-blade functionality, allowing
it to wield three weapons. This will put any
would-be hero to the test for sure. A great
deal of strength and confidence alike are
required to contend with one of these.
Enemy.Enemy_Keese_Electric_PictureBook:
The electricity that engulfs the bodies of these
bat-like Keese makes them more dangerous
than the standard type. They're capable of
shocking anything they touch.
Enemy.Enemy_Keese_Fire_PictureBook:
The fire that engulfs the bodies of these bat-
like Keese makes them more dangerous than
the standard type. They're capable of setting
fire to anything they touch.
Enemy.Enemy_Keese_Ice_PictureBook:
The intense frost that engulfs the bodies of
these bat-like Keese makes them more
dangerous than the standard type. They're
capable of freezing anything they touch.
Enemy.Enemy_Keese_PictureBook:
The unpredictable flight pattern of this
nocturnal bat-like species can make fighting
them a nuisance, but they're weak enough
to fell with a single strike. Sometimes they'll
attack in packs, but even then, a pack can
be sent packing with a single attack.
Enemy.Enemy_Lizalfos_Bone_Junior_PictureBook:
The remains of Lizalfos appear in the dark of
the night. They're as sly as ever, even now
that they're just some bones stacked atop
each other. However, their bodies are much
more fragile, and a single solid hit can reduce
them to pieces. If a skull remains intact, they
will pull themselves back up and continue to
fight. They've been known to grab the wrong
skull at times, but they never seem to mind...
Enemy.Enemy_Lizalfos_Dark_PictureBook:
These Lizalfos have been influenced by
Ganon's fiendish magic to become the
strongest Lizalfos of all. They're called
"silver" for their unique coloring and
also to denote their rarity. Their purple
pattern makes them even more distinct.
Enemy.Enemy_Lizalfos_Electric_PictureBook:
These quick-witted, lizard-like monsters can
be found all over Hyrule. They can emit strong
electrical currents from their bodies, so don't
get too close. Their horns are brimming with
electricity, which will discharge and arc to
nearby areas if struck by an arrow. They
tend to live in desert climates.
Enemy.Enemy_Lizalfos_Fire_PictureBook:
These quick-witted, lizard-like monsters can
be found all over Hyrule. Their fiery breath
makes them pretty dangerous, but exposure
to cold will kill them instantly. They mainly
make their homes in volcanic areas but have
also been sighted in the Akkala region.
Enemy.Enemy_Lizalfos_Gold_PictureBook:
With brutal strength and extreme resilience,
this type of Lizalfos somehow surpasses
Silver Lizalfos in sheer power. It is said they
are actually Silver Lizalfos who mysteriously
transformed after being struck by lightning.
Perhaps that is why they have such a high
tolerance for electric attacks.
Enemy.Enemy_Lizalfos_Ice_PictureBook:
These quick-witted, lizard-like monsters can
be found all over Hyrule. The balls of ice they
spit make them particularly troublesome, but
exposure to fire will kill them instantly. Their
homes are mainly on snowy mountains.
Enemy.Enemy_Lizalfos_Junior_PictureBook:
These quick-witted, lizard-like monsters can
be found all over Hyrule. They're a sly species
that lurks underwater or uses camouflage
to blend in with the environment to launch
ambushes. Moreover, they never sleep.
They're meat eaters by nature but will
enjoy the occasional insect or two.
Enemy.Enemy_Lizalfos_Middle_PictureBook:
These quick-witted, lizard-like monsters
can be found all over Hyrule. Compared
to the green Lizalfos, many of these carry
much stronger weapons and are generally
much tougher.
Enemy.Enemy_Lizalfos_Senior_PictureBook:
These quick-witted, lizard-like monsters can
be found all over Hyrule. This particular type
tends to carry some pretty strong weapons,
so they are among the most dangerous
Lizalfos.
Enemy.Enemy_Lynel_Dark_PictureBook:
Silver Lynels are not to be trifled with. They
have been influenced by Ganon's fiendish
magic, so they are the strongest among the
Lynel species, surpassing even the strength
of those with white manes. The term "silver"
denotes not only their color but also their
rarity. The purple stripes help them to stand
out even more.
Enemy.Enemy_Lynel_Gold_PictureBook:
With brutal strength and extreme resilience,
this type of Lynel somehow surpasses
Silver Lynels in sheer power. It is said they
are actually Silver Lynels who mysteriously
transformed after being struck by lightning.
If you see one, get away as fast as you can.
Enemy.Enemy_Lynel_Junior_PictureBook:
These fearsome monsters have lived in Hyrule
since ancient times. They possess intense
intelligence, resilience, and strength, making
them among the most dangerous monsters in
all the land. This is compounded by the fact
that they have a natural resistance to all
elements. You would be wise to challenge
a Lynel only if you're very well prepared.
Enemy.Enemy_Lynel_Middle_PictureBook:
These fearsome monsters have lived in
Hyrule since ancient times. Compared to the
standard Lynel, those with blue manes are
much tougher and are equipped with much
stronger weapons. Facing off against a Lynel
is ill-advised, but if you must, be sure you're
well prepared.
Enemy.Enemy_Lynel_Senior_PictureBook:
These fearsome monsters have lived in Hyrule
since ancient times. Their ability to breathe
fire makes White-Maned Lynels among the
toughest of the species; each one of their
attacks is an invitation to the grave. There
are so few eyewitness accounts of this breed
because a White-Maned Lynel is not one to
let even simple passersby escape with
their lives.
Enemy.Enemy_Moriblin_Bone_Junior_PictureBook:
The remains of Moblins appear in the dark
of the night. Even the toughest Moblins
become fragile when they're little more
than a pile of bones, so they'll crumble
after just a few attacks. However, as
long as a skull remains intact, they'll
continue to pull themselves back
together and go on fighting.
Enemy.Enemy_Moriblin_Dark_PictureBook:
The strongest of all Moblins, Ganon's fiendish
magic has allowed them to surpass even
the Black Moblins in strength and resilience.
They're called "silver" for both their body
color as well as their rarity. The purple
patterns on their bodies also help them
to stand out.
Enemy.Enemy_Moriblin_Gold_PictureBook:
With brutal strength and extreme resilience,
this type of Moblin somehow surpasses
Silver Moblins in sheer power. It is said they
are actually Silver Moblins who mysteriously
transformed after being struck by lightning.
Perhaps that is why they have such a high
tolerance for electric attacks.
Enemy.Enemy_Moriblin_Junior_PictureBook:
This heavyweight species of monster can be
found all over Hyrule. They're physically very
strong, their legs alone strong enough to
resist the force of a bomb blast. They're
much more dangerous than Bokoblins. In
fact, Moblins have been known to pick up
Bokoblins and throw them as makeshift
projectile weapons.
Enemy.Enemy_Moriblin_Middle_PictureBook:
These heavyweight monsters can be found all
over Hyrule. They're much tougher than their
standard counterparts and often have much
stronger weapons equipped.
Enemy.Enemy_Moriblin_Senior_PictureBook:
These heavyweight monsters can be found
all over Hyrule and are among the most
dangerous types of Moblin. They're extremely
resilient and are often armed with some of
the strongest weapons Moblins can carry.
Enemy.Enemy_Octarock_Desert_PictureBook:
These particularly clever monsters bury
themselves in deep sand or snow and
disguise themselves as treasure chests.
Anyone who approaches the chests is
attacked. The treasure chests are not
magnetic, which proves that they are
actually a part of these monsters' bodies.
Enemy.Enemy_Octarock_Forest_PictureBook:
Although originally an aquatic species, this
type has adapted to life in the forest. They
hide among the trees, disguising themselves
as grass or unassuming shrubbery, and then
attack when someone wanders by.
Enemy.Enemy_Octarock_PictureBook:
Although they spend most of their time in
water, the drop in barometric pressure that
occurs when it rains causes an air sac
within these octopus-like monsters to inflate
and lift them into the air. The rocks they spit
out can be bounced back with a shield.
Enemy.Enemy_Octarock_Snow_PictureBook:
These octopus-like monsters live in snowy
fields and disguise themselves as grass.
When someone wanders by, they spring
into action and attack by spitting snowballs.
Enemy.Enemy_Octarock_Stone_PictureBook:
This octopus-like species of monster lives in
volcanic regions. When they inhale, they're
preparing to spit out flaming rocks but have
been known to suck up weapons or bombs
in the same breath.
Enemy.Enemy_Wizzrobe_Electric_PictureBook:
These spell-casting monsters can be found
all over Hyrule. They use their lightning rods
to hurl balls of electricity or to summon
monsters surging with electricity and have
been known to cause thunderstorms in the
area. The weather will normalize once the
Wizzrobe is defeated.
Enemy.Enemy_Wizzrobe_Electric_Senior_PictureBo:
These spell-casting monsters can be found
all over Hyrule. They use their
thunderstorm rods to hurl balls of electricity
or to summon monsters surging with electricity
and have been known to cause thunderstorms
in the area. The weather will normalize once
the Wizzrobe is defeated.
Enemy.Enemy_Wizzrobe_Fire_PictureBook:
These spell-casting monsters can be found
all over Hyrule. They use their fire rods to
hurl fireballs or to summon flaming monsters
and have been known to severely raise the
temperature around them. The weather will
normalize once the Wizzrobe is defeated.
Enemy.Enemy_Wizzrobe_Fire_Senior_PictureBook:
These spell-casting monsters can be found
all over Hyrule. They use their meteor rods
to hurl fireballs or to summon flaming monsters
and have been known to severely raise the
temperature around them. The weather will
normalize once the Wizzrobe is defeated.
Enemy.Enemy_Wizzrobe_Ice_PictureBook:
These spell-casting monsters can be found
all over Hyrule. They use their ice rods to
create freezing blasts of air or to summon
frozen monsters and have been known to
cause blizzards to severely decrease the
temperature around them. The weather will
normalize once the Wizzrobe is defeated.
Enemy.Enemy_Wizzrobe_Ice_Senior_PictureBook:
These spell-casting monsters can be found
all over Hyrule. They use their blizzard rods
to create freezing blasts of air or to summon
frozen monsters and have been known to
cause blizzards to severely decrease the
temperature around them. The weather will
normalize once the Blizzrobe is defeated.
Enemy.Priest_Boss_Normal_PictureBook:
The arbiter of worthiness for the hero who
wishes to control a Divine Beast, following
a revelation from the Goddess Hylia.

As the last part of the final trial, the monk
offers a challenge of ancient techniques.
Enemy.RemainsFire_Drone_A_01_PictureBook:
These sentries dispatched from Divine Beast
Vah Rudania are equipped with searchlights
that can spot intruders.

GelEnemy.Enemy_Chuchu_Electric_Junior_PictureBook:
This low-level gel monster is engulfed in 
electricity. Its strength varies depending on
its size. It tends to explode if attacked from
close range, so the use of spears, arrows,
and other ranged weapons is advised.
GelEnemy.Enemy_Chuchu_Fire_Junior_PictureBook:
This low-level gel monster is engulfed in
flames. Its strength varies depending on its
size. It tends to explode if attacked from
close range, so the use of spears, arrows,
and other ranged weapons is advised.
GelEnemy.Enemy_Chuchu_Ice_Junior_PictureBook:
This low-level gel monster is engulfed in 
freezing-cold air. Its strength varies depending
on its size. It tends to explode if attacked from
close range, so the use of spears, arrows,
and other ranged weapons is advised.
GelEnemy.Enemy_Chuchu_Junior_PictureBook:
This low-level, gel-based monster can be
found all over Hyrule. It tends to spring its
attacks on unsuspecting prey from the
ground or from trees. Its strength varies by
size, and the type of jelly it drops varies
depending on whether the Chuchu was
heated up, cooled down, or shocked.

GiantEnemy.Enemy_Giant_Bone_PictureBook:
The mere remains of what was once a giant
monster known as a Hinox. These skeletal
beasts appear at nighttime. Much like their
living counterparts, the Stalnox will tear entire
trees from the ground to use as weapons.
Furthermore, even if it appears defeated at
first, it will keep coming back for more as long
as its eye is left intact.
GiantEnemy.Enemy_Giant_Junior_PictureBook:
The largest monster to make its home in
Hyrule, the Hinox lives primarily in forested
areas. A keen awareness of your surroundings
is paramount when facing one, as Hinox are
known for tearing entire trees from the ground
and using them as weapons. A deft hand can
steal weapons off the necklaces they wear.
GiantEnemy.Enemy_Giant_Middle_PictureBook:
The largest monster to make its home in
Hyrule, the Hinox lives primarily in forested
areas. A keen awareness of your surroundings
is paramount when facing one, as Hinox are
known for tearing entire trees from the ground
and using them as weapons. Blue Hinox wear
greaves that can be burnt away to expose
their feet. A deft hand can steal weapons off
the necklaces they wear.
GiantEnemy.Enemy_Giant_Senior_PictureBook:
The largest monster to make its home in
Hyrule, the Hinox lives primarily in forested
areas. A keen awareness of your surroundings
is paramount when facing one, as Hinox are
known for tearing entire trees from the ground
and using them as weapons. Black Hinox
wear metal greaves that conduct electricity
rather well. A deft hand can steal weapons
off the necklaces they wear.
GiantEnemy.Enemy_Golem_Fire_PictureBook:
This enormous monster is naturally
camouflaged as molten rock. Neither sword
nor arrow can pierce its fiery form. Merely
touching its magma-hot body can burn
you pretty badly, but you may be able
to scale it if you can use something
to chill its flames.
GiantEnemy.Enemy_Golem_Fire_R_PictureBook:
This monster is an Igneo Talus subspecies
that is camouflaged as molten rock. It lives
in lava for many years before emerging at an
enormous size. It is wildly powerful and emits
a tremendous amount of heat, causing a
constant updraft in its vicinity. This monster is
so fearsome it has earned the title of Titan.
GiantEnemy.Enemy_Golem_Ice_PictureBook:
This enormous monster is naturally
camouflaged as a frozen rock formation.
Neither sword nor arrow can pierce its frigid
form. Merely touching its frosty body can
leave you with severe frostbite, but you may
be able to scale it if you use something to
thaw its icy exterior.
GiantEnemy.Enemy_Golem_Junior_PictureBook:
This enormous monster is naturally
camouflaged as a rock formation. Neither
sword nor arrow can pierce its stony form,
but a cunning adventurer knows to scale
its body and attack the ore sprouting from
its peak.
GiantEnemy.Enemy_Golem_Middle_PictureBook:
This enormous monster is naturally
camouflaged as a rock formation. Neither
sword nor arrow can pierce its stony form,
but a cunning adventurer knows to scale
its body and attack the ore sprouting from
its peak. Unlike your average Stone Talus,
this type's ore deposit consists mostly of
luminous stone.
GiantEnemy.Enemy_Golem_Senior_PictureBook:
This enormous monster is naturally
camouflaged as a rock formation. Neither
sword nor arrow can pierce its stony form,
but a cunning adventurer knows to scale
its body and attack the ore sprouting from
its peak. Unlike your average Stone Talus,
this type's ore deposit contains a large
amount of precious ore.

Guardian.Enemy_Guardian_A_Fixed_Moss_PictureBook:
The Sheikah of ancient Hyrule developed
this as a weapon to combat Ganon, but it
was destroyed during the Great Calamity.
Ages of weather and neglect have left it in
a state of disrepair. Approach with caution;
some of these derelict models have been
known to awaken from stasis and attack
when approached.
Guardian.Enemy_Guardian_A_PictureBook:
The Sheikah of ancient Hyrule developed
this as a weapon to combat Ganon. Its six
legs give it extraordinary mobility compared
to most current vehicles, and its powerful
laser provides far greater offensive capability
than conventional weaponry. Destroying the
legs severely reduces its mobility.
Guardian.Enemy_Guardian_B_PictureBook:
The Sheikah of ancient Hyrule developed
this as a weapon to combat Ganon. This
stationary model was used for defending
important structures. Its offensive power
is on par with other Guardians, and omitting
the legs kept the manufacturing costs low.
Guardian.Enemy_Guardian_C_PictureBook:
The Sheikah of ancient Hyrule developed
this as a weapon to combat Ganon. This
flying model is an improvement over the
walking type, capable of either attacking
or surveying from the air. Destroying the
propeller will ground it.

Horse.GameRomHorse00L_PictureBook:
This giant horse is the last of its kind. Its
physical capabilities completely overshadow
those of regular horses, but its temperament
is extremely wild. Only a truly skilled rider can
train, or even catch, this beast of a mount.
This is a horse that chooses its rider.
Horse.GameRomHorse00S_PictureBook:
Smaller than horses, these are raised as
livestock in the countryside, so they don't
exist in the wild. They're more powerful
than they look and specialize in transporting
baggage. This has made them popular with
traveling merchants.
Horse.GameRomHorseBone_PictureBook:
This skeletal horse is ridden by monsters.
It was once a regular horse, but Ganon's
power revived it from death. It cannot
maintain its bone structure in the daytime.
Horse.GameRomHorseNushi_PictureBook:
This noble creature watches over all animals
that make their homes in the forest. Legends
say this holy creature is a reincarnation of a
sage that died on the lands it now protects.
It has an acute awareness of its surroundings,
so it seldom appears before people. It's
sometimes known by its other name, Satori.
Horse.GameRomHorseZelda_PictureBook:
The Hyrulean royal family that perished 100
years ago would sometimes ride atop white
horses as a display of their divine right. This
white horse may be a descendant of one
once ridden by royalty.
Horse.GameRomHorse_PictureBook:
These can most often be found on plains.
Their usefulness as transportation has made
them valuable since ancient times. That said,
wild horses do tend to get spooked and run
off when approached, so if you're looking to
snag one, it's best to sneak up on it.

HorseReins.GameRomHorseReins_00_Desc:
An exceptionally average bridle. Given
to anyone who registers a wild horse
at a stable.
HorseReins.GameRomHorseReins_01_Desc:
A standard bridle. The design doesn't
really stand out, which is why it's well
suited to any type of horse. A favorite
among peddlers and travelers alike.
HorseReins.GameRomHorseReins_02_Desc:
This bridle is well known for being a favorite
of the Hyrulean royal family. Its gold
ornamentations leave an impression, but
its true value lies in its solid craftsmanship.
HorseReins.GameRomHorseReins_03_Desc:
Hyrulean knights once outfitted their horses
with this bridle. It boasts additional armor to
protect the horse's head and neck.
HorseReins.GameRomHorseReins_04_Desc:
This bridle was handmade by Kilton, but it
looks like he may have had some monstrous
horse in mind when he made it. It includes a
mask that conceals the horse's head.
HorseReins.GameRomHorseReins_05_Desc:
Most often used in festivals, this gem of a
bridle is decorated with some charming
little feathers. It's great for adding just a
splash of color to any horse.
HorseReins.GameRomHorseReins_10_Desc:
A mysterious bridle made with forgotten
ancient technology. Equipping a horse with
this will maximize their abilities, increasing
the number of spurs associated with them.

HorseSaddle.GameRomHorseSaddle_00_Desc:
An exceptionally average saddle. Given
to anyone who registers a wild horse
at a stable.
HorseSaddle.GameRomHorseSaddle_01_Desc:
A standard saddle designed for comfort
during long journeys. Its durable material
holds strong in all sorts of weather, which
has made it a favorite among travelers.
HorseSaddle.GameRomHorseSaddle_02_Desc:
The shimmering emblem design of this saddle
signifies its origins with the Hyrulean royal
family. They say Princess Zelda herself once
used this saddle for her own beloved horse.
HorseSaddle.GameRomHorseSaddle_03_Desc:
Hyrulean knights favored this saddle.
Only the most elite among them were
allowed to outfit their mounts with it.
HorseSaddle.GameRomHorseSaddle_04_Desc:
Kilton hand made this saddle. Apparently
he had some sort of monstrous horse in
mind as he worked on it. It looks strange
but is certainly usable.
HorseSaddle.GameRomHorseSaddle_05_Desc:
This ornamental saddle is used in festivals.
The delicate embroidery and arrangement
of gems leaves a lasting impression. It's
perfect for those who want to stand out.
HorseSaddle.GameRomHorseSaddle_10_Desc:
A mysterious saddle made with forgotten
ancient technology. Equip a horse with this
and use

Item.Get_TwnObj_DLC_MemorialPicture_A_01_Desc:
A picture of Zelda and the five Champions,
taken after the inauguration ceremony at
Hyrule Castle. Kass gifted you this precious
item after completing The Champions' Ballad.
Item.Item_Boiled_01_Desc:
A bird egg boiled using water from naturally
occurring hot springs. It's popular among
children and is easy to make.
Item.Item_ChilledFish_01_Desc:
That's one cold fish. Eating it won't restore
many hearts, but it will lower your body
temperature a bit.
Item.Item_ChilledFish_02_Desc:
This salmon doesn't taste quite as fishy
because the excess fat has been removed.
It's exceptionally cold, so eating it provides
a temporary boost to heat resistance.
Item.Item_ChilledFish_03_Desc:
Being frozen has condensed the taste
of fish inside this trout's body. Eating it
will provide a temporary boost to your
heat resistance.
Item.Item_ChilledFish_04_Desc:
The crunchy, icy texture of this chilled
carp is quite the delicacy. Eating it will
temporarily increase your heat resistance.
Item.Item_ChilledFish_05_Desc:
This frozen porgy is the ideal snack for hiking
through hot climates like the Gerudo Desert.
Eating it provides a temporary boost to your
heat resistance.
Item.Item_ChilledFish_06_Desc:
This hearty bass has been frozen by cold air.
Eating it will be a challenge because it's
frozen solid, but if you persevere, it will
temporarily increase your heat resistance.
Item.Item_ChilledFish_07_Desc:
Doesn't provide as much companionship as
an unfrozen crab, but it won't spoil during
your travels. Eat it to gain a temporary boost
to your heat resistance.
Item.Item_ChilledFish_08_Desc:
The distinct glow of this sneaky river snail
has diminished after it's been frozen, but
eating it like this will provide a temporary
increase to your heat resistance.
Item.Item_ChilledFish_09_Desc:
It takes a skilled chef to get the meat out of
this frozen hearty blueshell snail. Eating this
will provide a temporary increase to your
heat resistance.
Item.Item_Chilled_01_Desc:
A frozen slab of animal meat. If you can
manage to chew it up and swallow it, you'll
restore some hearts and lower your body
temperature.
Item.Item_Chilled_02_Desc:
High-quality, frozen animal meat. Doesn't
restore many hearts, but it can lower your
body temperature.
Item.Item_Chilled_03_Desc:
This raw gourmet meat has been frozen for
easy traveling. It's kept its flavor through the
freezing process. Eating it as is will provide
a temporary boost to your heat resistance.
Item.Item_Chilled_04_Desc:
It's as hard as a rock but is supposedly
edible. It restores a small number of hearts
and has a cooling effect.
Item.Item_Chilled_05_Desc:
High-quality, frozen bird meat. It's so solid it
looks like it could be used as a weapon.
Eating it will restore some hearts and cool
you down, but don't break your teeth on it.
Item.Item_Chilled_06_Desc:
This raw whole bird may have been
frozen solid, but its flavor remains intact.
Eating it will provide a temporary boost
to your heat resistance.
Item.Item_Enemy_00_Desc:
The severed horn of a Bokoblin, a creature
often encountered on the plains of Hyrule.
It isn't edible, but it can be tossed into a
stew with some critters to make an elixir.
Item.Item_Enemy_01_Desc:
A tooth obtained from a Bokoblin. It's worn
down and not very sharp, but it's still pretty
hard. Cook it alongside a critter to make
an elixir.
Item.Item_Enemy_02_Desc:
A rare material obtained by defeating a
Bokoblin. It convulses on its own every now
and then, which is really creepy, but perhaps
it has a use.
Item.Item_Enemy_03_Desc:
This winding horn once grew atop the head
of a Lizalfos. It's too hard to use for cooking,
but stores are willing to buy it from you. It
can also be used to make elixirs.
Item.Item_Enemy_04_Desc:
This talon once grew from the elbow of a
Lizalfos. You can stew it with critters to
make elixirs, but it may have some
other uses, as well.
Item.Item_Enemy_05_Desc:
The severed tail of a Lizalfos. It continues to
wriggle even after being separated from its
body. That kind of vitality makes it highly
valued as an ingredient in elixirs.
Item.Item_Enemy_06_Desc:
This splendid horn once grew atop the head
of a Moblin. It can't be used in normal food
recipes, but it does have some use as an
ingredient in making elixirs.
Item.Item_Enemy_07_Desc:
A sharp fang obtained from a Moblin. It's too
hard to be reshaped into a tool, but it can
be tossed into a stew with some critters to
create elixirs.
Item.Item_Enemy_08_Desc:
This prized ingredient can be obtained from
Moblins. Its odor is too pungent for normal
food preparation, but stew it with some
critters to make elixirs.
Item.Item_Enemy_12_Desc:
The Lynel this horn once grew upon surely
misses it. It's exceptionally hardso hard
that most blades cannot scratch it. Throw
it into a stew with critters to make elixirs.
Item.Item_Enemy_13_Desc:
This rare ingredient can be obtained only
from a Lynel's foot. It's larger and heavier
than a horse's hoof. It's useful for making
elixirs but may have uses beyond that.
Item.Item_Enemy_14_Desc:
This highly sought-after ingredient can only
be obtained from a Lynel. It pulses with the
vitality of a Lynel, a strength that makes it
invaluable as an ingredient for elixirs.
Item.Item_Enemy_15_Desc:
A jiggly substance that normally comes from
a Fire Chuchu. It consistently gives off heat.
If struck, it will explode in a ball of flame.
Item.Item_Enemy_16_Desc:
A jiggly substance that came from an
Electric Chuchu. Electricity pulses through
its gelatinous mass. If struck, it will explode
in a burst of electric current.
Item.Item_Enemy_17_Desc:
A jiggly substance that came from an
Ice Chuchu. It's cool to the touch, and
squeezing it seems to relieve stress.
If struck, it will explode in a cold mist.
Item.Item_Enemy_18_Desc:
The wing of a Keese. It's covered with very
short, sharp fur. It's not much use by itself,
but you can mix it with critters to make
something useful.
Item.Item_Enemy_19_Desc:
A rare material dropped by a defeated
Keese. It's fun to look at, but it doesn't
seem to have much use at first glance.
But it must be good for something...
Item.Item_Enemy_20_Desc:
This can only be obtained from an Octorok-
type enemy. It's too acidic for cooking, but
it's highly valued as an ingredient for elixirs.
Item.Item_Enemy_21_Desc:
This can only be obtained from an Octorok-
type enemy. You can sell it to a store, or you
can make elixirs with it, but it may have other
uses, as well.
Item.Item_Enemy_24_Desc:
A sturdy fin obtained from a Molduga. It can
be used to make elixirs, but there may be
someone willing to trade for it.
Item.Item_Enemy_25_Desc:
A giant organ obtained from a Molduga. This
invaluable ingredient is hard to come by,
and its use is shrouded in mystery.
Item.Item_Enemy_26_Desc:
A gear used in ancient machinery.
Despite being incredibly old, its build quality
is leaps and bounds above anything built
using current technology.
Item.Item_Enemy_27_Desc:
A screw used in ancient machinery. It's made
of an unknown material, and no matter how
many times it's turned, its threads never
seem to show signs of wear.
Item.Item_Enemy_28_Desc:
A spring used in ancient machinery. It is light
and buoyant enough to float on water, and
no matter how many times it's compressed,
it never loses tension.
Item.Item_Enemy_29_Desc:
A machine part used in ancient machinery.
It's incredibly sturdy, and it's not made of
any recognizable material. It may come in
handy someday.
Item.Item_Enemy_30_Desc:
This crystal was made using lost technology.
At one time it was the power source for
ancient machines. This item is very valuable
to researchers.
Item.Item_Enemy_31_Desc:
A giant energy crystal made using lost
ancient technology. Cores this large are an
extremely rare find. A researcher would
probably know how to use this.
Item.Item_Enemy_32_Desc:
A nail obtained from a Hinox. It's as thick
as a plate of armor and can be stewed
with critters to make elixirs.
Item.Item_Enemy_33_Desc:
A tooth obtained from a Hinox. It's so
large, it's hard to believe it's a real tooth.
It can be used to make elixirs.
Item.Item_Enemy_34_Desc:
A giant, smelly Hinox organ of unknown
function. Upon close inspection, it appears to
be quivering. It can be used to make an
elixir, but some say it has other uses, as well.
Item.Item_Enemy_38_Desc:
This precious scale fell from the red spirit
Dinraal. It emanates a great heat. You
can use it in cooking, but just eating it
seems like a waste.
Item.Item_Enemy_39_Desc:
This valuable claw was plucked from the red
spirit Dinraal. It was extremely hot before it
was removed. You could sell it to a store, but
it must have some other use.
Item.Item_Enemy_40_Desc:
A gelatinous substance that came from a
Chuchu. It's unusable in this state, but
applying a bit of elemental stimulation will
change its form.
Item.Item_Enemy_41_Desc:
The severed tail of a Fire-Breath Lizalfos.
Its flavor makes the flesh inedible, but toss
it into a stew with some critters, and you'll
have yourself a nice elixir.
Item.Item_Enemy_42_Desc:
The severed tail of an Ice-Breath Lizalfos. Its
hard scales and flesh make it unsuitable for
cooking, but it's perfect for making elixirs.
Item.Item_Enemy_43_Desc:
The severed tail of an Electric Lizalfos.
Its powerful stench makes it unappetizing
and unfit for cooking, but it's highly valued
as an ingredient for elixirs.
Item.Item_Enemy_44_Desc:
A rare Fire Keese wing. There isn't enough
Fire Keese attached to it to burn you, but
it does have a slight warmth to it. It can
be used as an ingredient for elixirs.
Item.Item_Enemy_45_Desc:
A rare Electric Keese wing. The part of the
Electric Keese that produces electricity is not
in its wings, so it won't shock you. Toss it in
with some critters to make elixirs.
Item.Item_Enemy_46_Desc:
A rare Ice Keese wing. Its frozen surface
gleams attractively, but its usefulness isn't
readily apparent.
Item.Item_Enemy_47_Desc:
This shard fell from the red spirit Dinraal's
fang. It's exceptionally hard and therefore
impossible to process, but apparently it
can be used as a material for something.
Item.Item_Enemy_48_Desc:
This shard chipped and fell off the red spirit
Dinraal. Its horn is said to be the crystallized
power of fire itself. It sells for a high price,
but rumors say there's some other use for it.
Item.Item_Enemy_49_Desc:
This precious scale fell from the blue spirit
Naydra. It contains a bitter cold within.
You can use it in cooking, but just eating
it seems like a waste.
Item.Item_Enemy_50_Desc:
This valuable claw was plucked from the blue
spirit Naydra. It was freezing cold before it
was removed. You could sell it, but there
must be some other use for it.
Item.Item_Enemy_51_Desc:
This shard fell from the blue spirit Naydra's
fang. It's much harder than any metal, so it's
impossible to process. Yet rumors say it can
be used as a material for something.
Item.Item_Enemy_52_Desc:
This shard chipped and fell off the blue spirit
Naydra. It's said the horn is the crystallized
power of ice itself. It sells for quite a bit, but
rumors say it has some other use.
Item.Item_Enemy_53_Desc:
This precious scale fell from the golden spirit
Farosh. It contains powerful electricity within.
You can cook with it, but just eating it seems
like a waste.
Item.Item_Enemy_54_Desc:
This claw was plucked from the golden spirit
Farosh. Its electricity was expelled before it
was removed, so it's safe to handle. A store
will buy it, but it must have some other use.
Item.Item_Enemy_55_Desc:
This shard fell from the golden spirit Farosh's
fang. It's so hard, hammers bounce right off
it, so it's impossible to process. Yet rumors
say it does have some use as a material.
Item.Item_Enemy_56_Desc:
This shard fell off the golden spirit Farosh.
It's said the horn is the crystallized power
of electricity itself. It sells for a lot, but there
must be some other use for it.
Item.Item_Enemy_57_Desc:
This inflatable Octorok organ has a lot of lift,
so attach it to items you want to see float.
Hold it in your hands, and then place it on
an object to attach it.
Item.Item_FishGet_A_Desc:
An ordinary fish that can be found all over
Hyrule. It can be eaten raw, but cooking
it amplifies its healing benefits.
Item.Item_FishGet_A_PictureBook:
An ordinary fish that can be found all over
Hyrule. It can be eaten raw, but cooking
it amplifies its healing benefits.
Item.Item_FishGet_B_Desc:
This large fish lives near the shoreline.
Its sizable body can store a lot of nutrients.
When cooked into a dish, it will temporarily
increase your maximum hearts.
Item.Item_FishGet_B_PictureBook:
This large fish lives near the shoreline.
Its sizable body can store a lot of nutrients.
When cooked into a dish, it will temporarily
increase your maximum hearts.
Item.Item_FishGet_C_Desc:
This blue trout prefers cold bodies of water.
Its skin contains enzymes that keep its body
cool, and when cooked into a dish, it will
temporarily boost your heat resistance.
Item.Item_FishGet_C_PictureBook:
This blue trout prefers cold bodies of water.
Its skin contains enzymes that keep its body
cool, and when cooked into a dish, it will
temporarily boost your heat resistance.
Item.Item_FishGet_D_Desc:
This trout makes its home in the freshwater
lakes. Its scales have an insulating
compound that, when cooked into a dish,
offers resistance to electricity.
Item.Item_FishGet_D_PictureBook:
This trout makes its home in the freshwater
lakes. Its scales have an insulating
compound that, when cooked into a dish,
offers resistance to electricity.
Item.Item_FishGet_E_Desc:
This freshwater fish lives alongside its less
mighty carp ilk. A compound in its liver
promotes muscle growth. Dishes cooked with
it will temporarily increase your attack power.
Item.Item_FishGet_E_PictureBook:
This freshwater fish lives alongside its less
mighty carp ilk. A compound in its liver
promotes muscle growth. Dishes cooked with
it will temporarily increase your attack power.
Item.Item_FishGet_F_Desc:
This ocean-dwelling fish comes with one rude
attitude. The compounds in its flesh elevate
your competitive spirit when it's cooked into
a dish, thus increasing your attack power.
Item.Item_FishGet_F_PictureBook:
This ocean-dwelling fish comes with one rude
attitude. The compounds in its flesh elevate
your competitive spirit when it's cooked into
a dish, thus increasing your attack power.
Item.Item_FishGet_G_Desc:
This porgy's body is covered in armor-hard
scales. The compounds in its scales, when
cooked into a dish, fortify your bones and
temporarily boost your defense.
Item.Item_FishGet_G_PictureBook:
This porgy's body is covered in armor-hard
scales. The compounds in its scales, when
cooked into a dish, fortify your bones and
temporarily boost your defense.
Item.Item_FishGet_H_Desc:
Calcium deposits in the scales of this ancient
fish make them as hard as armor. Cooking it
into a dish will fortify your bones, temporarily
increasing your defense.
Item.Item_FishGet_H_PictureBook:
Calcium deposits in the scales of this ancient
fish make them as hard as armor. Cooking it
into a dish will fortify your bones, temporarily
increasing your defense.
Item.Item_FishGet_I_Desc:
This fish makes its home in cold water, giving
it extra layers of fat. It temporarily increases
your maximum hearts when used in cooking.
Item.Item_FishGet_I_PictureBook:
This fish makes its home in cold water, giving
it extra layers of fat. It temporarily increases
your maximum hearts when used in cooking.
Item.Item_FishGet_J_Desc:
This red trout prefers warm bodies of water.
It has a special organ specifically for storing
heat. When cooked into a dish, it temporarily
boosts your resistance to the cold.
Item.Item_FishGet_J_PictureBook:
This red trout prefers warm bodies of water.
It has a special organ specifically for storing
heat. When cooked into a dish, it temporarily
boosts your resistance to the cold.
Item.Item_FishGet_K_Desc:
This snail lives on sandy beaches in large
numbers. Its flesh contains a high amount of
stimulants, so when cooked into a dish, it
temporarily increases your maximum hearts.
Item.Item_FishGet_K_PictureBook:
This snail lives on sandy beaches in large
numbers. Its flesh contains a high amount of
stimulants, so when cooked into a dish, it
temporarily increases your maximum hearts.
Item.Item_FishGet_L_00_Desc:
This Hyrule bass got to be the biggest fish
by never getting caught (until now). Its long
life results in a cooked dish that will restore
a lot of stamina.
Item.Item_FishGet_L_Desc:
This Hyrule bass got to be the biggest fish
by never getting caught (until now). Its long
life results in a cooked dish that will restore
a lot of stamina.
Item.Item_FishGet_L_PictureBook:
This Hyrule bass got to be the biggest fish
by never getting caught (until now). Its long
life results in a cooked dish that will restore
a lot of stamina.
Item.Item_FishGet_M_Desc:
This large, glow-in-the-dark snail lives in
fresh water. When cooked into a dish, it
heightens your senses so you can move
about silently.
Item.Item_FishGet_M_PictureBook:
This large, glow-in-the-dark snail lives in
fresh water. When cooked into a dish, it
heightens your senses so you can move
about silently.
Item.Item_FishGet_X_Desc:
Consuming the bioluminescent compound
that makes this fish glow in the dark will
increase concentration. Dishes cooked
with it will suppress noise when consumed.
Item.Item_FishGet_X_PictureBook:
Consuming the bioluminescent compound
that makes this fish glow in the dark will
increase concentration. Dishes cooked
with it will suppress noise when consumed.
Item.Item_FishGet_Z_Desc:
This wild armored carp has been bred into
a prizewinning fish. Its beautifully colored
markings do not occur in nature. It offers
no special effects when cooked.
Item.Item_FishGet_Z_PictureBook:
This wild armored carp has been bred into
a prizewinning fish. Its beautifully colored
markings do not occur in nature. It offers
no special effects when cooked.
Item.Item_Fruit_A_Desc:
A common fruit found on trees all around
Hyrule. Eat it fresh, or cook it to increase
its effect.
Item.Item_Fruit_A_PictureBook:
A common fruit found on trees all around
Hyrule. Eat it fresh, or cook it to increase
its effect.
Item.Item_Fruit_B_Desc:
A fruit that grows in cold, snowy regions
known for its tangy, sweet flavor. It doesn't
offer any special effects, but it's a popular
cooking ingredient.
Item.Item_Fruit_B_PictureBook:
A fruit that grows in cold, snowy regions
known for its tangy, sweet flavor. It doesn't
offer any special effects, but it's a popular
cooking ingredient.
Item.Item_Fruit_C_Desc:
Cacti found in the Gerudo Desert bear this
sweet fruit. It's naturally insulated, so when
cooked into a dish, it provides resistance
against electricity.
Item.Item_Fruit_C_PictureBook:
Cacti found in the Gerudo Desert bear this
sweet fruit. It's naturally insulated, so when
cooked into a dish, it provides resistance
against electricity.
Item.Item_Fruit_D_Desc:
This fruit's mighty odor has earned it the
nickname "king of fruits." It offers immense
restorative powers; dishes cooked with it will
temporarily increase your maximum hearts.
Item.Item_Fruit_D_PictureBook:
This fruit's mighty odor has earned it the
nickname "king of fruits." It offers immense
restorative powers; dishes cooked with it will
temporarily increase your maximum hearts.
Item.Item_Fruit_E_00_Desc:
The plant that bears these seeds grows near
deep water. The roots draw nutrients from the
water, which boosts your movement speed
when the seeds are cooked into a dish.
Item.Item_Fruit_E_Desc:
The plant that bears these seeds grows near
deep water. The roots draw nutrients from the
water, which boosts your movement speed
when the seeds are cooked into a dish.
Item.Item_Fruit_E_PictureBook:
The plant that bears these seeds grows near
deep water. The roots draw nutrients from the
water, which boosts your movement speed
when the seeds are cooked into a dish.
Item.Item_Fruit_F_Desc:
This resilient fruit can flourish even in the
heat of the desert. The hydrating liquid
inside provides a cooling effect that, when
cooked, increases your heat resistance.
Item.Item_Fruit_F_PictureBook:
This resilient fruit can flourish even in the
heat of the desert. The hydrating liquid
inside provides a cooling effect that, when
cooked, increases your heat resistance.
Item.Item_Fruit_G_Desc:
Fruit from palm trees that grow near the
ocean. It doesn't offer any special effects
but will increase your heart recovery
when used as an ingredient.
Item.Item_Fruit_G_PictureBook:
Fruit from palm trees that grow near the
ocean. It doesn't offer any special effects
but will increase your heart recovery
when used as an ingredient.
Item.Item_Fruit_H_Desc:
This fruit grows mainly in tropical forests
of the Faron region. When it's used as an
ingredient, the resulting dish will temporarily
increase your attack power.
Item.Item_Fruit_H_PictureBook:
This fruit grows mainly in tropical forests
of the Faron region. When it's used as an
ingredient, the resulting dish will temporarily
increase your attack power.
Item.Item_Fruit_I_Desc:
This pepper is exploding with spice.
Cook with it to create dishes that
will raise your body temperature and
help you withstand the cold.
Item.Item_Fruit_I_PictureBook:
This pepper is exploding with spice.
Cook with it to create dishes that
will raise your body temperature and
help you withstand the cold.
Item.Item_Fruit_J_Desc:
An extremely tough pumpkin raised in village
fields. When cooked, that toughness
manifests itself by considerably
upping defense.
Item.Item_Fruit_J_PictureBook:
An extremely tough pumpkin raised in village
fields. When cooked, that toughness
manifests itself by considerably
upping defense.
Item.Item_Fruit_K_Desc:
Often found on the ground near trees.
Squirrels adore this nut, so you may have
competition while foraging. Add one to a
meal for a nutty seasoning.
Item.Item_Fruit_L_Desc:
Small birds love this nut. You can eat it raw
for a minor effect, but it can also be added
as a spice to other recipes.
Item.Item_InsectGet_K_Desc:
This crab is well known for its exceptionally
sharp pincers. When cooked, the strength
compound in its claws will increase your
attack power.
Item.Item_InsectGet_K_PictureBook:
This crab is well known for its exceptionally
sharp pincers. When cooked, the strength
compound in its claws will increase your
attack power.
Item.Item_InsectGet_O_Desc:
This crab's shell is particularly hard. When
cooked into a dish, its fat and meat bolster
the body to increase your defense.
Item.Item_InsectGet_O_PictureBook:
This crab's shell is particularly hard. When
cooked into a dish, its fat and meat bolster
the body to increase your defense.
Item.Item_InsectGet_Z_Desc:
This crab appears in large numbers when it
rains. One bite of its delectable meat, and
you'll forget all your exhaustion. Replenishes
your stamina when cooked into a dish.
Item.Item_InsectGet_Z_PictureBook:
This crab appears in large numbers when it
rains. One bite of its delectable meat, and
you'll forget all your exhaustion. Replenishes
your stamina when cooked into a dish.
Item.Item_Material_01_Desc:
When boiled with other ingredients, the cane
breaks down into a sweet juice necessary
for making cakes and other sweets. It's
commonly found in ingredients stores.
Item.Item_Material_02_Desc:
Made from several types of spices, this
secret Goron seasoning has been handed
down for generations. An initial wave of
spiciness paves the way for the sweetness.
Item.Item_Material_03_Desc:
This grain is a favorite among residents of
Kakariko Village. It's grown in regions with a
lot of water and is quite versatile. Used as an
ingredient in things like risotto and rice balls.
Item.Item_Material_04_Desc:
A fresh bird egg necessary for making dishes
such as omelets and crepes. You can snag
them from birds' nests if you're sneaky.
Nutritious and delicious, perfect for cooking.
Item.Item_Material_05_00_Desc:
This fresh milk comes from Hateno cows and
white goats kept in the village. It's delicious
on its own but can also be used as an
ingredient in soups and stews.
Item.Item_Material_05_Desc:
This fresh milk comes from Hateno cows and
white goats kept in the village. It's delicious
on its own but can also be used as an
ingredient in soups and stews.
Item.Item_Material_06_Desc:
Butter made from the milk of a domesticated
white goat. In addition to being used in
dishes like stews and meunire, it's often
used when making cakes and other sweets.
Item.Item_Material_07_Desc:
This grain is cultivated extensively on the
Tabantha Plains. It's ground finely with a
millstone to be used in cooking. Use it to
make things such as stews and breads.
Item.Item_Material_08_Desc:
A result of Kilton's research into monsters,
this suspicious spice can be used to punch
up dishes while cooking. Apparently it can be
used to make a number of monstrous meals.
Item.Item_Meat_01_Desc:
Meat obtained from animals in plains and
forests. You can eat it raw, but cooking it will
make it more delicious and nutritious.
Item.Item_Meat_02_Desc:
A fresh, high-quality piece of animal meat.
This stuff isn't easy to come by, so savor it.
Cook it to recover more hearts.
Item.Item_Meat_06_Desc:
This meat is tougher and chewier than a
standard steak. Tastes better cooked.
Item.Item_Meat_07_Desc:
A high-quality piece of meat that's hard to
come by. You can eat it raw, but cooking it
first will recover more hearts.
Item.Item_Meat_11_Desc:
This prized cut of meat is usually from a large
animal. Any connoisseur would rank this
tender, juicy cut of meat "gourmet." Expect
an exquisite meal when cooking with this.
Item.Item_Meat_12_Desc:
This prized meat can be obtained from
certain birds. It gets full points for flavor,
nutrition, and volume. It pairs perfectly with
other ingredients or can be enjoyed alone.
Item.Item_MushroomGet_D_Desc:
A mushroom that can grow almost anywhere
but prefers ceilings and sheer cliffs. Cook it
before eating to temporarily increase your
movement speed.
Item.Item_MushroomGet_D_PictureBook:
A mushroom that can grow almost anywhere
but prefers ceilings and sheer cliffs. Cook it
before eating to temporarily increase your
movement speed.
Item.Item_Mushroom_A_Desc:
A green mushroom that grows near trees in
the forest. It's chock-full of natural energy.
Cook it to release its stamina-restoration
properties.
Item.Item_Mushroom_A_PictureBook:
A green mushroom that grows near trees in
the forest. It's chock-full of natural energy.
Cook it to release its stamina-restoration
properties.
Item.Item_Mushroom_B_Desc:
Often found at the base of pine trees in cold
climates, these mushrooms are cool to the
touch and can be used to cook dishes that
allow you to stay cool even in arid regions.
Item.Item_Mushroom_B_PictureBook:
Often found at the base of pine trees in cold
climates, these mushrooms are cool to the
touch and can be used to cook dishes that
allow you to stay cool even in arid regions.
Item.Item_Mushroom_C_Desc:
A bright red mushroom that grows in hot
climates. Imbued with the power of heat, 
they can be used to cook dishes that will
allow you endure the bitter cold.
Item.Item_Mushroom_C_PictureBook:
A bright red mushroom that grows in hot
climates. Imbued with the power of heat, 
they can be used to cook dishes that will
allow you endure the bitter cold.
Item.Item_Mushroom_E_Desc:
A common mushroom found near trees
around Hyrule. Eat it to restore half a heart.
Item.Item_Mushroom_E_PictureBook:
A common mushroom found near trees
around Hyrule. Eat it to restore half a heart.
Item.Item_Mushroom_F_00_Desc:
This rare mushroom has a rich scent.
Cook it before eating to temporarily
increase your maximum hearts.
Item.Item_Mushroom_F_Desc:
This rare mushroom has a rich scent.
Cook it before eating to temporarily
increase your maximum hearts.
Item.Item_Mushroom_F_PictureBook:
This rare mushroom has a rich scent.
Cook it before eating to temporarily
increase your maximum hearts.
Item.Item_Mushroom_H_Desc:
This mushroom grows wild in the Gerudo
region. The cap is naturally insulated, so
when used in cooking, it will offer protection
against electricity.
Item.Item_Mushroom_H_PictureBook:
This mushroom grows wild in the Gerudo
region. The cap is naturally insulated, so
when used in cooking, it will offer protection
against electricity.
Item.Item_Mushroom_J_Desc:
A strange mushroom that glows softly in
the forest at night. Cooking it into a dish
unlocks the nutrients in its cap, resulting in
a meal that will allow you to move stealthily.
Item.Item_Mushroom_J_PictureBook:
A strange mushroom that glows softly in
the forest at night. Cooking it into a dish
unlocks the nutrients in its cap, resulting in
a meal that will allow you to move stealthily.
Item.Item_Mushroom_L_Desc:
This mushroom is known for the natural slice
in its cap. Eating it fosters your competitive
spirit. Use it when cooking to prepare a dish
that will increase your strength.
Item.Item_Mushroom_L_PictureBook:
This mushroom is known for the natural slice
in its cap. Eating it fosters your competitive
spirit. Use it when cooking to prepare a dish
that will increase your strength.
Item.Item_Mushroom_M_Desc:
The cap of this mushroom is very hard.
Use it when cooking to prepare a dish
that increases your defense.
Item.Item_Mushroom_M_PictureBook:
The cap of this mushroom is very hard.
Use it when cooking to prepare a dish
that increases your defense.
Item.Item_Mushroom_N_00_Desc:
Years of going unpicked have allowed this
hearty truffle to grow quite large. It's chock-
full of nutrients. When cooked into a dish, it
temporarily increases your maximum hearts.
Item.Item_Mushroom_N_Desc:
Years of going unpicked have allowed this
hearty truffle to grow quite large. It's chock-
full of nutrients. When cooked into a dish, it
temporarily increases your maximum hearts.
Item.Item_Mushroom_N_PictureBook:
Years of going unpicked have allowed this
hearty truffle to grow quite large. It's chock-
full of nutrients. When cooked into a dish, it
temporarily increases your maximum hearts.
Item.Item_Mushroom_O_Desc:
A rare yellowish-orange mushroom. Cook it
before eating to temporarily increase your
stamina limit.
Item.Item_Mushroom_O_PictureBook:
A rare yellowish-orange mushroom. Cook it
before eating to temporarily increase your
stamina limit.
Item.Item_Ore_A_00_Desc:
The most precious gem one can find in
Hyrule, its signature sparkle has charmed
Hyruleans for generations. As such, it has
sold for a very high price since ancient times.
Item.Item_Ore_A_Desc:
The most precious gem one can find in
Hyrule, its signature sparkle has charmed
Hyruleans for generations. As such, it has
sold for a very high price since ancient times.
Item.Item_Ore_B_Desc:
A precious red gem mined from large ore
deposits found throughout Hyrule. Rubies
contain the power of fire and have fetched
a high price since ancient times.
Item.Item_Ore_C_Desc:
A precious blue gem mined from natural rock
formations. Sapphires contain the very
essence of ice. They've been known to
fetch a high price since ancient times.
Item.Item_Ore_D_Desc:
This precious yellow gem contains the power
of electricity. It's been known to fetch a
high price since ancient times.
Item.Item_Ore_E_Desc:
A valuable ore that gives off a mesmerizing
iridescence similar to the inside of a seashell.
It contains the power of water.
Item.Item_Ore_F_Desc:
A fossilized resin with a caramelesque sheen
to it. It's been valued as a component in
decorations and crafting since ancient times.
Item.Item_Ore_G_Desc:
This mysterious mineral gives off a pale blue
glow in the dark, which some believe to be
souls of the dead. Apparently, this stone can
be used as a base to make special clothing.
Item.Item_Ore_H_Desc:
Crystallized salt from the ancient sea
commonly used to season meals. 
Cannot be eaten in this form.
Item.Item_Ore_I_Desc:
Strike it with a metallic weapon to generate
a spark. This portable fire starter breaks after
one use, but it can create a long-lasting
flame if you use it near firewood.
Item.Item_Ore_J_Desc:
A mysterious stone fragment that fell from
the sky. It looks like it would fetch a good
price, but you may be able to use it in
certain recipes as well.
Item.Item_PlantGet_A_Desc:
This healthy herb grows abundantly in the
plains of Hyrule. Cook it before eating to
increase the number of hearts it restores.
Item.Item_PlantGet_A_PictureBook:
This healthy herb grows abundantly in the
plains of Hyrule. Cook it before eating to
increase the number of hearts it restores.
Item.Item_PlantGet_B_Desc:
A rare radish that grows best in sunny plains.
Cook it before eating to temporarily increase
your maximum hearts.
Item.Item_PlantGet_B_PictureBook:
A rare radish that grows best in sunny plains.
Cook it before eating to temporarily increase
your maximum hearts.
Item.Item_PlantGet_C_Desc:
This hearty radish has grown much larger
than the average radish. It's rich in analeptic
compounds that, when cooked into a dish,
temporarily increase your maximum hearts.
Item.Item_PlantGet_C_PictureBook:
This hearty radish has grown much larger
than the average radish. It's rich in analeptic
compounds that, when cooked into a dish,
temporarily increase your maximum hearts.
Item.Item_PlantGet_E_Desc:
This medicinal plant grows in high elevations,
such as mountains in the Hebra or Gerudo
regions. When cooked into a dish, it will
temporarily increase your heat resistance.
Item.Item_PlantGet_E_PictureBook:
This medicinal plant grows in high elevations,
such as mountains in the Hebra or Gerudo
regions. When cooked into a dish, it will
temporarily increase your heat resistance.
Item.Item_PlantGet_F_Desc:
This medicinal plant grows in hot regions,
such as the Gerudo Desert. It's warm to the
touch and increases your cold resistance
when cooked into a dish.
Item.Item_PlantGet_F_PictureBook:
This medicinal plant grows in hot regions,
such as the Gerudo Desert. It's warm to the
touch and increases your cold resistance
when cooked into a dish.
Item.Item_PlantGet_G_Desc:
This medicinal plant is known for its sharp
thorns and for the fruit it bears. The fruit
contains a compound that increases attack
power when cooked into a dish.
