Item.Item_PlantGet_G_PictureBook:
This medicinal plant is known for its sharp
thorns and for the fruit it bears. The fruit
contains a compound that increases attack
power when cooked into a dish.
Item.Item_PlantGet_H_Desc:
This tough medicinal plant cannot be
broken, but it can be cooked. Its
durable yet flexible fibers raise your
defense when cooked into a dish.
Item.Item_PlantGet_H_PictureBook:
This tough medicinal plant cannot be
broken, but it can be cooked. Its
durable yet flexible fibers raise your
defense when cooked into a dish.
Item.Item_PlantGet_I_Desc:
A plant that grows in quieter areas of Hyrule.
At night, it gives off a soft glow.
Cook with it to increase your stealth.
Item.Item_PlantGet_I_PictureBook:
A plant that grows in quieter areas of Hyrule.
At night, it gives off a soft glow.
Cook with it to increase your stealth.
Item.Item_PlantGet_J_Desc:
This lovely flower was said to have been a
favorite of the princess of Hyrule. Once
feared to have gone extinct, it's recently
been spotted growing in the wild.
Item.Item_PlantGet_J_PictureBook:
This lovely flower was said to have been a
favorite of the princess of Hyrule. Once
feared to have gone extinct, it's recently
been spotted growing in the wild.
Item.Item_PlantGet_L_Desc:
This medicinal plant grows abundantly in the
Gerudo Desert. Its peculiar fibers conduct
electricity, which will increase your electricity
resistance when cooked into a dish.
Item.Item_PlantGet_L_PictureBook:
This medicinal plant grows abundantly in the
Gerudo Desert. Its peculiar fibers conduct
electricity, which will increase your electricity
resistance when cooked into a dish.
Item.Item_PlantGet_M_Desc:
This carrot is cultivated extensively in
Kakariko Village. It strengthens the legs
and hips when cooked into a dish, which
helps increase your movement speed.
Item.Item_PlantGet_M_PictureBook:
This carrot is cultivated extensively in
Kakariko Village. It strengthens the legs
and hips when cooked into a dish, which
helps increase your movement speed.
Item.Item_PlantGet_O_Desc:
This vitality-rich flower blooms mainly on
cliffsides. When cooked into a dish, the
nourishing compounds increase your
movement speed.
Item.Item_PlantGet_O_PictureBook:
This vitality-rich flower blooms mainly on
cliffsides. When cooked into a dish, the
nourishing compounds increase your
movement speed.
Item.Item_PlantGet_Q_Desc:
Highly valued as a medicinal plant, this
carrot contains large amounts of nourishing
energy. When cooked into a dish, it boosts
your stamina beyond its maximum limit.
Item.Item_PlantGet_Q_PictureBook:
Highly valued as a medicinal plant, this
carrot contains large amounts of nourishing
energy. When cooked into a dish, it boosts
your stamina beyond its maximum limit.
Item.Item_RoastFish_01_Desc:
A bass that's been cooked whole over an
open flame. It's flaky and savory smelling.
Offers more hearts than the raw version.
Item.Item_RoastFish_02_Desc:
An open flame has crisped the skin of this
hearty bass to perfection. It's a sizable
portion and contains just the right amount
of fat to create an exceptionally tasty dish.
Item.Item_RoastFish_03_Desc:
This trout can be found all over Hyrule.
Served river-to-table, it's simply cooked
for a soft and flaky flesh with a mild flavor.
Item.Item_RoastFish_04_Desc:
A fresh hearty salmon roasted simply over
an open flame without any additional
flavoring. Not only is the skin edible, but
it gives off a rather nice aroma as well.
Item.Item_RoastFish_07_Desc:
Roasting this freshwater carp helped to
suppress some of its stench, making it
easier to stomach. You can really sink
your teeth into the thick, meaty flesh.
Item.Item_RoastFish_09_Desc:
The soft and fluffy texture of this seafaring
fish has been enhanced by roasting it over
an open fire. The crisp, aromatic skin is
particularly delicious.
Item.Item_RoastFish_11_Desc:
The shell of this hearty blueshell snail acted
as a tiny slow cooker as it was roasted.
Some people love the trademark bitterness
of its tail meat.
Item.Item_RoastFish_13_Desc:
Sneaky river snail roasted whole in its shell.
The meat is soft and a little chewy. Pulling all
the meat from the shell in one go fills you
with a sense of accomplishment.
Item.Item_RoastFish_15_Desc:
A whole crab slow-roasted in its shell. The
soft, flaky flesh pairs nicely with the scent
of the charred shell for a meal that assaults
all five of your senses in all the best ways.
Item.Item_Roast_01_Desc:
Raw meat cooked over an open flame.
Cooking it has increased its flavor and the
number of hearts it provides.
Item.Item_Roast_02_Desc:
Raw bird drumstick that's been cooked to
a crisp, skin and all. It's devoid of seasoning,
but it has a simple, accessible taste.
Restores more hearts than the raw variety.
Item.Item_Roast_03_Desc:
Direct heat has softened and sweetened
this apple. Eat it to restore three quarters
of a heart.
Item.Item_Roast_04_Desc:
This toasted stamella shroom doesn't grant
any special effects, but it will restore
a bit of health.
Item.Item_Roast_05_Desc:
A hearty truffle with a toasted, crispy outside
and a warm, gooey inside.
Item.Item_Roast_06_Desc:
A Hylian shroom toasted to perfection.
The taste and fragrance are amplified,
restoring more health to its consumer.
Item.Item_Roast_07_Desc:
This wildberry was prepared over an open
flame to alter its sweet taste. It recovers
more health than if eaten raw.
Item.Item_Roast_08_Desc:
This voltfruit from the Gerudo Desert has
been charred to really bring out its sweet
and sour flavors.
Item.Item_Roast_09_Desc:
This hearty durian was roasted whole inside
its hard shell. Unfortunately, roasting it did
nothing to remove its distinct odor. Eat it to
recover a lot of hearts.
Item.Item_Roast_10_Desc:
This palm fruit was broiled with direct heat,
resulting in steamed flesh inside the rind.
Best served at the moment the juices
emerge while roasting.
Item.Item_Roast_11_Desc:
These mighty bananas have been roasted
whole. Cooking them through has turned the
fruit inside into a sticky, rich, aromatic syrup.
Item.Item_Roast_12_Desc:
This hydromelon was roasted whole for
a very soft and flaky inner flesh with a
rather intriguing flavor. Now this is your
money melon!
Item.Item_Roast_13_Desc:
A pepper that's been gently caressed by an
open flame. It's much less spicy now.
Item.Item_Roast_15_Desc:
This fortified pumpkin has been roasted
whole. The hard rind serves as a container
for the steamed pumpkin flesh inside.
Item.Item_Roast_16_Desc:
Flame-roasted fleet-lotus seeds.
Peel the skin back to get to the soft
and flaky center.
Item.Item_Roast_18_Desc:
A roasted hearty radish. Fragrant and
warm, it has no special effect but will
restore hearts.
Item.Item_Roast_19_Desc:
A roasted big hearty radish.
To take such a precious vegetable
and put it to the fire is decadent
in a way.
Item.Item_Roast_24_Desc:
A fragrant swift carrot that's been
lightly roasted. It doesn't have any
special effects, but it will restore
some health.
Item.Item_Roast_27_Desc:
Lightly toasted mighty thistle. It has no
special effects, but now that it's been grilled,
the pointy ends go down smooth.
Item.Item_Roast_28_Desc:
Simple, roasted armoranth. The heat has
frayed the hard, chewy fiber just enough
to make it easy to eat.
Item.Item_Roast_31_Desc:
A fully roasted chillshroom. It's evenly
toasted and tastes a lot better than
when eaten raw. Eating it will restore
a bit of health.
Item.Item_Roast_32_Desc:
It's always a good idea to keep a fully
roasted sunshroom or two on hand just
in case. Eat it to recover a bit of health.
Item.Item_Roast_33_Desc:
It's not very shocking that this fully roasted
zapshroom is delicious. Eat it to recover
a bit of health.
Item.Item_Roast_36_Desc:
A rushroom that's been put to the torch.
It may have lost its speedy properties, but
at least it tastes good now.
Item.Item_Roast_37_Desc:
A razorshroom that's been exposed to
direct heat. Its sharp exterior has softened
considerably. Restores a bit of health.
Item.Item_Roast_38_Desc:
An ironshroom exposed to an open
flame. Its once-tough exterior is now crunchy
and tasty. Restores a bit of health.
Item.Item_Roast_39_Desc:
A whole, toasted silent shroom. High heat
may have destroyed its soft glow, but it's
now fragrant and tasty.
Item.Item_Roast_40_Desc:
Raw prime meat cooked over an open flame.
The outside is perfectly browned, while
the inside is mouthwateringly juicy.
Item.Item_Roast_41_Desc:
Prime meat that's been flame-seared to
perfection. The outside is crispy, but the
inside is juicy. Eat it to recover hearts.
Item.Item_Roast_45_Desc:
The highest quality raw gourmet meat, just
kissed by an open flame. No additional
seasonings have been added, which lets
the natural flavor of the meat really shine.
Item.Item_Roast_46_Desc:
This raw whole bird has been tickled by
an open flame to bring out its flavor. Less
is more, as the lack of additional seasoning
allows its natural taste to shine.
Item.Item_Roast_48_Desc:
An acorn cooked with direct heat.
Its nutty aroma has been amplified.
Item.Item_Roast_49_Desc:
This big hearty truffle has been roasted
whole. It gets full points for aroma and
nutrition. Eat it to recover a lot of hearts.
Item.Item_Roast_50_Desc:
This flame-kissed endura carrot makes for a
truly extravagant single-item dish. The fire
really brought out its sweetness.
Item.Item_Roast_51_Desc:
Roasting a bird egg whole in its shell like this
helps retain water, making the egg a bit
chewier than usual.
Item.Item_Roast_52_Desc:
A tree seed roasted to amplify its fragrance.
Gives more hearts than the raw variety.
Item.Item_Roast_53_Desc:
A toasted endura shroom. It doesn't grant
any special effects, but boy is it tasty!
Item.KeySmall_Desc: A key that can unlock doors inside shrines.
Item.Obj_AncientArrow_B_01_Desc:
A bundle of five ancient arrows.
Daggers created using ancient technology
have been repurposed for use as arrows.
Extremely effective against Guardians.
Item.Obj_AncientArrow_B_01_PictureBook:
A bundle of five ancient arrows.
Daggers created using ancient technology
have been repurposed for use as arrows.
Extremely effective against Guardians.
Item.Obj_AncientArrow_C_01_Desc:
A bundle of three ancient arrows.
Daggers created using ancient technology
have been repurposed for use as arrows.
Extremely effective against Guardians.
Item.Obj_AncientArrow_C_01_PictureBook:
A bundle of three ancient arrows.
Daggers created using ancient technology
have been repurposed for use as arrows.
Extremely effective against Guardians.
Item.Obj_Armor_115_Head_Desc:
A precious Gerudo heirloom reclaimed from
the Yiga. It has the power to withstand
Naboris's lightning. Guard it with your
life until you can return it to Riju.
Item.Obj_ArrowBundle_A_01_Desc:
A bundle of five common arrows.
The shafts of these arrows were carved from
the wood of a sturdy tree.
Item.Obj_ArrowBundle_A_01_PictureBook:
A bundle of five common arrows.
The shafts of these arrows were carved from
the wood of a sturdy tree.
Item.Obj_ArrowBundle_A_02_Desc:
A bundle of 10 common arrows.
The shafts of these arrows were carved from
the wood of a sturdy tree.
Item.Obj_ArrowBundle_A_02_PictureBook:
A bundle of 10 common arrows.
The shafts of these arrows were carved from
the wood of a sturdy tree.
Item.Obj_ArrowBundle_A_10_Desc:
A common arrow. Its shaft was carved from
the wood of a sturdy tree.
Item.Obj_ArrowBundle_A_10_PictureBook:
A common arrow. Its shaft was carved from
the wood of a sturdy tree.
Item.Obj_BombArrow_A_02_Desc:
A bundle of five bomb arrows.
The explosive powder packed into the tips
of these arrows ignites on impact, dealing
big damage to anything caught in the blast.
Item.Obj_BombArrow_A_02_PictureBook:
A bundle of five bomb arrows.
The explosive powder packed into the tips
of these arrows ignites on impact, dealing
big damage to anything caught in the blast.
Item.Obj_BombArrow_A_03_Desc:
A bundle of 10 bomb arrows.
The explosive powder packed into the tips
of these arrows ignites on impact, dealing
big damage to anything caught in the blast.
Item.Obj_BombArrow_A_03_PictureBook:
A bundle of 10 bomb arrows.
The explosive powder packed into the tips
of these arrows ignites on impact, dealing
big damage to anything caught in the blast.
Item.Obj_BombArrow_A_04_Desc:
A bundle of 20 bomb arrows.
The explosive powder packed into the tips
of these arrows ignites on impact, dealing
big damage to anything caught in the blast.
Item.Obj_BombArrow_A_04_PictureBook:
A bundle of 20 bomb arrows.
The explosive powder packed into the tips
of these arrows ignites on impact, dealing
big damage to anything caught in the blast.
Item.Obj_BombArrow_A_10_Desc:
A powerful arrow designed to destroy
monsters. The explosive powder packed into
the tip ignites on impact, dealing massive
damage to anything caught in the blast.
Item.Obj_DLC_HeroSeal_Gerudo_Desc:
The commemorative symbol of a lightning
trial's completion by one who wishes to
control a Divine Beast. Collecting three
emblems will lead to a new challenge.
Item.Obj_DLC_HeroSeal_Goron_Desc:
The commemorative symbol of a fire trial's
completion by one who wishes to control a
Divine Beast. Collecting three emblems
will lead to a new challenge.
Item.Obj_DLC_HeroSeal_Rito_Desc:
The commemorative symbol of a wind trial's
completion by one who wishes to control a
Divine Beast. Collecting three emblems
will lead to a new challenge.
Item.Obj_DLC_HeroSeal_Zora_Desc:
The commemorative symbol of a water trial's
completion by one who wishes to control a
Divine Beast. Collecting three emblems
will lead to a new challenge.
Item.Obj_DLC_HeroSoul_Gerudo_Desc:
Champion Urbosa's divine gift. Summons
powerful lightning to the surrounding area.
Trigger with a charge attack by holding
Item.Obj_DLC_HeroSoul_Goron_Desc:
Champion Daruk's divine gift. So long as
you're holding
Item.Obj_DLC_HeroSoul_Rito_Desc:
Champion Revali's divine gift. Creates an
upward draft that carries you into the sky.
Activate by charging your jump with
Item.Obj_DLC_HeroSoul_Zora_Desc:
Champion Mipha's divine gift. If your hearts
run out, you'll automatically be resurrected
with full health plus temporary bonus hearts.
It now requires less time to recharge.
Item.Obj_DungeonClearSeal_Desc:
A symbol of courage given to those who
have overcome the challenges of a shrine.
Item.Obj_ElectricArrow_A_02_Desc:
A bundle of 10 shock arrows.
Shock arrows break apart on impact,
channeling electricity into nearby objects.
Very effective against metals and moisture.
Item.Obj_ElectricArrow_A_02_PictureBook:
A bundle of 10 shock arrows.
Shock arrows break apart on impact,
channeling electricity into nearby objects.
Very effective against metals and moisture.
Item.Obj_ElectricArrow_A_03_Desc:
A bundle of five shock arrows.
Shock arrows break apart on impact,
channeling electricity into nearby objects.
Very effective against metals and moisture.
Item.Obj_ElectricArrow_A_03_PictureBook:
A bundle of five shock arrows.
Shock arrows break apart on impact,
channeling electricity into nearby objects.
Very effective against metals and moisture.
Item.Obj_FireArrow_A_02_Desc:
A bundle of 10 fire arrows.
Fire arrows break apart on impact,
igniting objects in the immediate area.
Incredibly effective against cold things.
Item.Obj_FireArrow_A_02_PictureBook:
A bundle of 10 fire arrows.
Fire arrows break apart on impact,
igniting objects in the immediate area.
Incredibly effective against cold things.

Fire arrows break apart on impact,

Incredibly effective against cold things.
Item.Obj_FireArrow_A_03_PictureBook:
A bundle of five fire arrows.
Fire arrows break apart on impact,

Incredibly effective against cold things.
Item.Obj_FireWoodBundle_Desc:
A portable bundle of wood. You can use this
to make a campfire if you have something to
light it.
Item.Obj_HeartUtuwa_A_01_Desc:
Your life force has been strengthened,
increasing your maximum number of hearts
by one.
Item.Obj_HeroSoul_Gerudo_Desc:
A destructive power born from the unbridled
anger of the Champion Urbosa. Summons
powerful lightning to the surrounding area.
Trigger with a charge attack by holding
Item.Obj_HeroSoul_Goron_Desc:
A protective power containing the perfect
defense of the Champion Daruk. It will
automatically protect you from all manner of
attacks as long as you're holding
Item.Obj_HeroSoul_Rito_Desc:
A blusterous power born from the spirit of the
Champion Revali. Creates an upward draft
that carries you into the sky.
Activate by charging jump with
Item.Obj_HeroSoul_Zora_Desc:
A restorative power born from the spirit of the
Champion Mipha. When your hearts run out,
you'll automatically be resurrected with full 
health plus temporary bonus hearts.
Item.Obj_IceArrow_A_02_Desc:
A bundle of 10 ice arrows.
Ice arrows break apart on impact,
freezing objects in the immediate area.
Incredibly effective against hot things.
Item.Obj_IceArrow_A_02_PictureBook:
A bundle of 10 ice arrows.
Ice arrows break apart on impact,
freezing objects in the immediate area.
Incredibly effective against hot things.

Ice arrows break apart on impact,

Incredibly effective against hot things.
Item.Obj_IceArrow_A_03_PictureBook:

Ice arrows break apart on impact,

Incredibly effective against hot things.
Item.Obj_KorokNuts_Desc:
This small seed was given to you by a Korok.
It has a distinct smell. If you gather a bunch
of them, you never know what may happen...
Item.Obj_Maracas_Desc:
Hestu's beloved maracas. He's been shaking
them since he was two years old.
Item.Obj_Photo_Animal_Desc: A picture of an animal, bird, fish, or insect.
Item.Obj_Photo_BossEnemy_Desc:
A picture of a powerful monster that at one
time stood in your way.
Item.Obj_Photo_Enemy_Desc:
A picture of one of the various monsters that
can be found throughout Hyrule.
Item.Obj_Photo_Material_Desc:
A picture of a cooking ingredient, such as an
apple or a mushroom.
Item.Obj_Photo_Other_Desc:
A picture of an exciting subject, such as a 
treasure chest or ore.
Item.Obj_Photo_Weapon_Desc:
A picture of a battle-tested weapon, such as
a sword, spear, or bow.
Item.Obj_ProofBook_Desc:
Inside the envelope is a picture of a
beautiful young woman of the Sheikah tribe.
Item.Obj_ProofGiantKiller_Desc:
A medal presented by Kilton in somber honor
of having defeated every Hinox. Ending a
monster's life is never an easy task, but at
times it is a necessary one.
Item.Obj_ProofGolemKiller_Desc:
A medal presented by Kilton in somber honor
of having defeated every Stone Talus. Taking
the life of a monster is a solemn act, but at
times it must be done.
Item.Obj_ProofKorok_Desc:
A gift of friendship given to you by Hestu.
It smells pretty bad.
Item.Obj_ProofSandwormKiller_Desc:
A medal presented by Kilton in somber honor
of having defeated every Molduga. Slaying a
monster is a heavy burden to bear. You must
steel yourself to carry that weight.
Item.Obj_StaminaUtuwa_A_01_Desc:
The size of your Stamina Wheel has been
increased, allowing you to perform more
actions before getting tired.
Item.Obj_WarpDLC_Desc:
This mysterious tool was made using
forgotten ancient technology. Place it
by opening your pouch and registering
your current location as a travel gate.
Item.PutRupee_Blue_Desc:
Five rupees. Its shiny blue facets make you
weak in the knees.
Item.PutRupee_Desc:
A single rupee. Its soft green glow puts a
smile on your face.
Item.PutRupee_Gold_Desc:
300 rupees! Its radiant golden shine
illuminates your soul.
Item.PutRupee_Purple_Desc:
50 rupees. Its violet glow fills your heart with
generosity.
Item.PutRupee_Red_Desc:
20 rupees. Its red luster tickles your
heartstrings.
Item.PutRupee_Silver_Desc:
100 rupees. Its dazzling silver light reflects
your beaming smile.

LastBoss.Enemy_Ganon_PictureBook:
The source of the darkness that has appeared
time and again throughout Hyrule's history.
It's been called many names, from "Great King
of Evil" to "Calamity." Hibernating within a
cocoon, it attempted to regenerate a physical
form after Link awoke but was forced to
confront him in an incomplete state.

MapDynamicPassive.Obj_Mineral_A_01_PictureBook:
This deposit contains a good deal of ore.
Breaking the rock will yield rock salt, flint,
and other ore and minerals of varying value.
MapDynamicPassive.Obj_Mineral_B_01_PictureBook:
This deposit contains a good deal of precious
ore and the occasional rare mineral, like ruby
and sapphire. Break it open to see what it
has to offer!
MapDynamicPassive.Obj_Mineral_C_01_PictureBook:
This deposit contains quite a bit of luminous
stone. Crack it open to get at the easily
processed rocks within.

NPC.Dm_DLC_GerudoBigPointLight_A_01_Name: Champion demo 663 Gerudo Town point light (small)
NPC.Dm_DLC_GerudoBigPointLight_B_01_Name: Champion demo 663 Gerudo Town point light (big)

Prey.Animal_Bear_A_PictureBook:
This king among animals is dangerous game
for even the most seasoned hunters. They'll
attack anyone who wanders into their territory
regardless of the wanderer's weaponry. As
their name implies, they have a natural love
of honey. Extreme caution is advised when
you spot one, but if you're sneaky enough
and maybe just a little bit crazy...
you just may be able to ride one.
Prey.Animal_Bear_B_PictureBook:
This breed of honeyvore bear is distinguished
by its gray fur. Even more ferocious than their
relatives, they're commonly believed to be
the most dangerous wild animal. They live
in deep snow away from villages, so it's
uncommon to encounter one. That said, if
you do find one, you'd be better off not
picking a fight with it.
Prey.Animal_Boar_A_PictureBook:
These medium-sized beasts can be found all
throughout Hyrule. You can most often find
them foraging for food in forests or meadows.
Although usually docile, they won't hesitate
to charge you full force if you get too close.
Prey.Animal_Boar_B_PictureBook:
These boars are known for their red tusks and
black fur. They're similar to your average
boars but are considerably stronger. Extra
caution is advised when hunting these.
Prey.Animal_Bull_A_PictureBook:
These wild cows come equipped with big,
strong horns. They live off grass that grows
near the waterfront. Their meat is considered
to be high quality, so they're a common target
among hunters. Fun fact: the domesticated
Hateno cow, often raised in villages, was bred
through selective breeding using these.
Prey.Animal_Cassowary_A_PictureBook:
This large bird makes its home in the volcanic
region of Eldin. Their heat-resistant feathers
and skin are evolutionary traits produced by
the harsh environment. Their wings are too
small to facilitate flight, but their long legs
make them pretty speedy runners.
Prey.Animal_Cow_A_PictureBook:
Originating in Hateno Village, these cows are
kept as livestock primarily for their milk. Their
horns are smaller than a water buffalo's, and
they're much more docile and therefore
easier to raise. Their horns are decorated
with bright colors when taken out to pasture.
Prey.Animal_Crow_A_PictureBook:
This bird is known for its cleverness and for
its distinct claws. They make their homes in
mountains, forests, and villages alike. Not
only are their jet-black feathers seen as an
ill omen, but they'll steal the crops right out
of a farmer's hands if given the chance.
Because of this, they're often met with enmity.
Prey.Animal_Deer_A_PictureBook:
These male deer are usually found deep in
the forest. They're well known for their huge,
branching antlers, which they'll swing in self-
defense if threatened. Deer are cautious by
nature so it can be tricky getting close, but
if you can capture one, you may be able to
take it for a ride.
Prey.Animal_Doe_A_PictureBook:
These female deer are often found alongside
a male. They're very timid animals by nature,
but they tend to let their guard down when
eating apples, a favorite food. This tidbit
of information can be useful to hunters.
Prey.Animal_Dog_A_PictureBook:
The native breed of this mammal varies by
region, but one thing remains true: this
animal has been known as "man's best friend"
since ancient times. They're very clever and
obedient, so aside from serving as pets, they
are also put to work watching over grazing
livestock. It's said that all Hylian retrievers
are descendants of the dog once owned by
the king of Hyrule.
Prey.Animal_Elk_A_PictureBook:
The largest breed of deer in Hyrule, this
mammal's origin was traced back to the
Tabantha region. It's easily distinguished
by its immense antlers, which these moose
shed and regrow yearly. Their meat is
tender and high quality, so it works well
in a stew.
Prey.Animal_Fox_A_PictureBook:
This breed of fox is common to grasslands
and forests and is hallmarked by its fluffy,
white-tipped tail. Unlike other foxes, they
tend to act independently rather than form
packs. Being omnivores, they hunt animals
smaller than themselves and often stick to
eating fruit and insects.
Prey.Animal_Fox_B_PictureBook:
This particular breed of grassland fox
makes its home in cold climates such
as the Tabantha region. Its fur turned
white as a means of adapting to snowy
weather, serving as a natural camouflage.
Because of this, spotting one in the snow
takes a keen eye.
Prey.Animal_Goat_A_PictureBook:
These goats are raised for their multiple uses.
Their milk can be drank or made into butter,
and their soft fur is used to make clothes.
Domesticated goats wear bells around their
necks so they can be easily found after being
let out to graze.
Prey.Animal_Gull_A_PictureBook:
These birds live near the ocean. They eat
mainly fish, so a flock of seagulls hovering
over water is a good indication of where
there are fish. Fishermen use this to their
advantage when searching for a catch
of their own.
Prey.Animal_Hawk_A_PictureBook:
These carnivorous birds live in plains or
highlands. They use their sharp talons
and beaks to catch and eat small animals
and other birds. They soar calmly through
the sky and search for prey from above.
Prey.Animal_Heron_A_PictureBook:
These birds live on waterfronts all throughout
Hyrule. Their characteristically thin legs and
long necks help them catch water-dwelling
fish or frogs for food. They lie perfectly still
in wait for their prey and then stretch out
their long necks to capture their meal.
Prey.Animal_Heron_B_PictureBook:
This breed of heron is characterized by the
pink tips of its feathers. Unlike its waterfront-
dwelling relative the blue-winged heron, these
live in grasslands or arid regions and subsist
on insects that live in the grass. They can
often be found walking about searching for
food but will fly away if they sense danger.
Prey.Animal_Kokko_A_PictureBook:
Villages often raise these birds for their eggs,
but some people actually keep them as pets.
They can't fly but can flap their wings mighty
furiously if picked up. They're usually calm
creatures, but if you're persistent in your
torment of them... Well...
Prey.Animal_LittleBird_A_PictureBook:
As the name suggests, these birds are rather
common around Hyrule. They mainly live in
plains or forests but sometimes venture out
to villages. Their diet consists of nuts and
small insects. They look pretty cute when
they jump around, but they don't have much
love for people.
Prey.Animal_LittleBird_B_PictureBook:
These small birds live in the Hebra region and
eat mainly nuts and wild plants. Their bright-
red feathers are often used as decorations.
Prey.Animal_LittleBird_C_PictureBook:
This breed of sparrow is most often seen in
the Lanayru region. They get most of their
food from leaves and plants that grow near
water. If it's safe enough, they can be spotted
bathing in puddles or shallow rivers.
Prey.Animal_LittleBird_D_PictureBook:
These small birds hail from the Faron region.
As the name suggests, their feathers are
more colorful than other sparrows', which
has made them a favorite among dilettantes.
They feed on small rain-forest insects, but
the omnivore in them loves nuts as well.
Prey.Animal_LittleBird_E_PictureBook:
This desert-dwelling breed of sparrow has
adapted to withstand the heat in the arid
climate of the Gerudo region. Sometimes
they can be spotted half-buried in the
sand, holding perfectly still as a means
of evading predators.
Prey.Animal_LittleBird_F_PictureBook:
This breed of sparrow is native to the Eldin
region. Their down is resistant to burning,
an evolutionary trait produced by the harsh
volcanic environment. They subsist on small
insects that hide inside rocks.
Prey.Animal_Pigeon_A_PictureBook:
These pigeons inhabit vast regions all
throughout Hyrule, so they can often be
found in forests, grasslands, or even villages.
They don't have a very strong sense of
awareness, so even less-skilled hunters
can nab them pretty easily.
Prey.Animal_Pigeon_B_PictureBook:
This breed of pigeon is well known for its vivid
feathers. They live mainly in the northern
forests and grasslands of Hyrule. They're most
fond of nuts and grain but won't pass up the
occasional insect or earthworm if offered.
Their meat is of a higher quality than a
typical wood pigeon's.
Prey.Animal_Ptarmigan_A_PictureBook:
This white-feathered breed of pigeon lives in
the Hebra region. It's said that a wood pigeon
survived atop a snowy mountain by changing
its feathers to blend in with the snow and
soon after became a white pigeon. They
have an extra layer of fat to guard against
the cold, so they have been known to yield
high-quality meat.
Prey.Animal_Ptarmigan_B_PictureBook:
This rare breed of pigeon lives near Death
Mountain. Their fireproof feathers are
valuable as clothing material. Their meat,
on the other hand, is not fireproof, and
it'll burn up as soon as it's struck.
Prey.Animal_Rhino_A_PictureBook:
This animal's horn is a whopping half the size
of its body. Although originally members of
arid-region rhinoceroses, these migrated to
colder climates and adapted to live in snowy
mountains. Their hides are particularly thick,
and their horns can cause some serious
damage, so only experienced hunters
should track these.
Prey.Animal_RupeeRabbit_A_PictureBook:
They may look like mere rabbits at a fleeting
glance, but these strange and aptly named
creatures glow with a mysterious blue light.
While the details of their origins are entirely
unknown, there is one thing we do know:
these peculiar little things have a penchant
for collecting rupees.
Prey.Animal_Sheep_A_PictureBook:
Originally native to the mountainous regions, 
these sheep were domesticated for their wool
and have since found a home in villages.
Once the fluffy wool grows out, it's harvested
and used to make clothing and bedding. 
They're calm, timid creatures and move about 
in small herds.
Prey.Animal_Squirrel_A_PictureBook:
These small creatures are known for their
large tails. They tend to live in forests and
subsist on acorns and other nuts. They
carry their food in their mouths but will
sometimes drop it when surprised in an
adorable display of shock.
Prey.Animal_SunazarashiSP_C_PictureBook:
This is Riju's own sand seal. It may look
intense, but she dotes on it regularly; the
ribbon it wears was a gift from her, and it even
has its own pen in Gerudo Town. It's far more
agile than any other sand seal and far more
outgoing. An ever-reliable partner to Riju,
Patricia is always ready to take off through
the desert at a moment's notice.
Prey.Animal_Sunazarashi_A_PictureBook:
These seals use their large flippers to move
through the sand as if swimming. They were
once wild animals but have since been
domesticated by the Gerudo. They rely on
their excellent hearing to find their way while
submerged in the sand. Their large, distinct
tusks look pretty ferocious, but their favorite
food is actually fruit.
Prey.Animal_WildDuck_A_PictureBook:
These birds can be found on waterfronts all
over Hyrule. Their webbed feet make them
excellent swimmers, and their long necks
allow them to duck their heads underwater
to find food. Their fatty meat is high quality.
Prey.Animal_WildGoat_A_PictureBook:
These herbivores make their home in
meadows and rocky areas. Their
characteristically strong legs and
hooves facilitate easy climbing over
rocks. Goats aren't very quick, so
they make good targets for
beginning hunters.
Prey.Animal_Wolf_A_PictureBook:
These wolves are not only carnivorous but
can also be downright fierce. They're highly
aggressive and aren't afraid to attack people.
They hunt in groups and surround their prey
as a means of bringing it down. That said, if
one of their own is injured, the rest are wise
enough to run away. They communicate via
howls, so if you're wandering the forest and
hear their call, you had best take care.
Prey.Animal_Wolf_B_PictureBook:
This contentious beast is native to the
Gerudo region. It makes its home in the
desert, so it doesn't have a problem with hot,
arid climates. They do hunt other beasts and
small animals but more often turn their sights
on people. They're a threat to anyone
traveling through the desert.
Prey.Animal_Wolf_C_PictureBook:
This breed of maraudo wolf lives in snowy,
mountainous areas, such as the Hebra
Mountains. They travel in packs similar to
their maraudo relatives but are considerably
tougher thanks to having adapted to their
harsh environment. They're made even
more dangerous by their white fur, which
provides a natural camouflage in the snow.

Sandworm.Enemy_SandwormR_PictureBook:
This massive monster swims beneath the
desert's sand. It is a subspecies of Molduga
that stored up a great deal of energy by
sleeping underground for hundreds of years.
Its power is superior to Molduga, as its skin is
rich with iron and acts as a protective shield.
Sandworm.Enemy_Sandworm_PictureBook:
This massive monster swims beneath the
desert's sand. It spends most of its time
submerged, but if it senses sound, it will
breach the surface to feast on whatever
it can grab. Running around carelessly
can be dangerous if you suspect there
may be one in the area.

SiteBoss.Enemy_SiteBoss_Bow_PictureBook:
This phantom of Ganon attacked the Divine
Beast Vah Medoh and was responsible for the
demise of the Champion Revali. It specializes
in long-range wind attacks.
SiteBoss.Enemy_SiteBoss_Lsword_PictureBook:
This phantom of Ganon attacked the Divine
Beast Vah Rudania and was responsible for
the demise of the Champion Daruk. It attacks
with a greatsword and fire magic.
SiteBoss.Enemy_SiteBoss_Spear_PictureBook:
This phantom of Ganon attacked the Divine
Beast Vah Ruta and was responsible for the
demise of the Champion Mipha. It attacks
with a spear and ice magic.
SiteBoss.Enemy_SiteBoss_Sword_PictureBook:
This phantom of Ganon attacked the Divine
Beast Vah Naboris and was responsible for
the demise of the Champion Urbosa. It
specializes in quick, lightning-based attacks.

WeaponBow.Weapon_Bow_001_Desc:
A small bow used by travelers for protection.
It doesn't do a lot of damage, but it can be
used to attack foes from a distance.
WeaponBow.Weapon_Bow_001_PictureBook:
A small bow used by travelers for protection.
It doesn't do a lot of damage, but it can be
used to attack foes from a distance.
WeaponBow.Weapon_Bow_002_Desc:
A bow designed for armed conflict.
Inflicts more damage than a civilian bow,
but it will still burn if it touches fire.
WeaponBow.Weapon_Bow_002_PictureBook:
A bow designed for armed conflict.
Inflicts more damage than a civilian bow,
but it will still burn if it touches fire.
WeaponBow.Weapon_Bow_003_Desc:
An upgraded Boko bow bound with animal
bone to boost its durability and firepower.
Its craftsmanship is sloppy, but it's light and
easy to use.
WeaponBow.Weapon_Bow_003_PictureBook:
An upgraded Boko bow bound with animal
bone to boost its durability and firepower.
Its craftsmanship is sloppy, but it's light and
easy to use.
WeaponBow.Weapon_Bow_004_Desc:
A basic Bokoblin bow made of wood. It's
made by taking any tree branch and just
tying a string to either end, so don't expect
much in the way of combat effectiveness.
WeaponBow.Weapon_Bow_004_PictureBook:
A basic Bokoblin bow made of wood. It's
made by taking any tree branch and just
tying a string to either end, so don't expect
much in the way of combat effectiveness.
WeaponBow.Weapon_Bow_006_Desc:
A wooden bow created by Lizalfos. It's
reinforced by the bones of a large fish
a marked improvement over any standard
wooden bow.
WeaponBow.Weapon_Bow_006_PictureBook:
A wooden bow created by Lizalfos. It's
reinforced by the bones of a large fish
a marked improvement over any standard
wooden bow.
WeaponBow.Weapon_Bow_009_Desc:
A Lynel-made bow crafted from rough metal.
True to the vicious nature of Lynel weaponry,
it fires a spread of multiple arrows at once.
Ideal for taking down quick-moving targets.
WeaponBow.Weapon_Bow_009_PictureBook:
A Lynel-made bow crafted from rough metal.
True to the vicious nature of Lynel weaponry,
it fires a spread of multiple arrows at once.
Ideal for taking down quick-moving targets.
WeaponBow.Weapon_Bow_011_Desc:
A Lizal bow with a grip reinforced by metal.
The body is made from the branches of a
flexible tree that grows near water, which
offers some serious destructive power.
WeaponBow.Weapon_Bow_011_PictureBook:
A Lizal bow with a grip reinforced by metal.
The body is made from the branches of a
flexible tree that grows near water, which
offers some serious destructive power.
WeaponBow.Weapon_Bow_013_Desc:
The Koroks made this bow for Hylians. It's
crafted from flexible wood and uses sturdy
vines for the bowstring. Its construction may
be simple, but it fires multiple arrows at once.
WeaponBow.Weapon_Bow_013_PictureBook:
The Koroks made this bow for Hylians. It's
crafted from flexible wood and uses sturdy
vines for the bowstring. Its construction may
be simple, but it fires multiple arrows at once.
WeaponBow.Weapon_Bow_014_Desc:
A bow favored by the Zora for fishing.
It doesn't boast the highest firepower,
but the special metal it's crafted from
prioritizes durability.
WeaponBow.Weapon_Bow_014_PictureBook:
A bow favored by the Zora for fishing.
It doesn't boast the highest firepower,
but the special metal it's crafted from
prioritizes durability.
WeaponBow.Weapon_Bow_015_Desc:
This Gerudo-made bow is popular for the fine
ornamentations along its limbs. Designed for
hunting and warfare alike, this bow was
engineered to strike distant targets.
WeaponBow.Weapon_Bow_015_PictureBook:
This Gerudo-made bow is popular for the fine
ornamentations along its limbs. Designed for
hunting and warfare alike, this bow was
engineered to strike distant targets.
WeaponBow.Weapon_Bow_016_Desc:
This bow is a favorite among Rito warriors.
The bowstring has been specially engineered
for aerial combat, which allows it to be drawn
faster than a normal bow.
WeaponBow.Weapon_Bow_016_PictureBook:
This bow is a favorite among Rito warriors.
The bowstring has been specially engineered
for aerial combat, which allows it to be drawn
faster than a normal bow.
WeaponBow.Weapon_Bow_017_Desc:
A highly refined Rito-made bow created by
a master Rito craftsman. Rito warriors favor
it for its superior rate of fire, which helps
them excel even further at aerial combat.
WeaponBow.Weapon_Bow_017_PictureBook:
A highly refined Rito-made bow created by
a master Rito craftsman. Rito warriors favor
it for its superior rate of fire, which helps
them excel even further at aerial combat.
WeaponBow.Weapon_Bow_023_Desc:
This bow is the result of Robbie's research.
Ancient Sheikah technology affords it
heightened functionality. Arrows fired from
it travel in a perfectly straight line.
WeaponBow.Weapon_Bow_023_PictureBook:
This bow is the result of Robbie's research.
Ancient Sheikah technology affords it
heightened functionality. Arrows fired from
it travel in a perfectly straight line.
WeaponBow.Weapon_Bow_026_Desc:
This massive Lynel bow sports a bowstring
made from a metal so tough, mere Hylians
have trouble drawing it back.
WeaponBow.Weapon_Bow_026_PictureBook:
This massive Lynel bow sports a bowstring
made from a metal so tough, mere Hylians
have trouble drawing it back.
WeaponBow.Weapon_Bow_027_Desc:
A Boko bow reinforced by fossils. Bokoblins
handpicked the materials it's made from, so
it boasts a respectable firepower.
WeaponBow.Weapon_Bow_027_PictureBook:
A Boko bow reinforced by fossils. Bokoblins
handpicked the materials it's made from, so
it boasts a respectable firepower.
WeaponBow.Weapon_Bow_028_Desc:
A bow without equal wielded by the Rito
Champion, Revali. It's said Revali could loose
arrows with the speed of a gale, making him
supreme in aerial combat.
WeaponBow.Weapon_Bow_028_PictureBook:
A bow without equal wielded by the Rito
Champion, Revali. It's said Revali could loose
arrows with the speed of a gale, making him
supreme in aerial combat.
WeaponBow.Weapon_Bow_029_Desc:
A bow passed down through the Sheikah
tribe. Concentrating before drawing the
string will allow you to target distant
enemies as easily as those nearby.
WeaponBow.Weapon_Bow_029_PictureBook:
A bow passed down through the Sheikah
tribe. Concentrating before drawing the
string will allow you to target distant
enemies as easily as those nearby.
WeaponBow.Weapon_Bow_030_Desc:
This bow is wielded by Lizalfos who are
expert marksmen. The metal that reinforces
much of the weapon adds some additional
weight but offers heightened durability.
WeaponBow.Weapon_Bow_030_PictureBook:
This bow is wielded by Lizalfos who are
expert marksmen. The metal that reinforces
much of the weapon adds some additional
weight but offers heightened durability.
WeaponBow.Weapon_Bow_032_Desc:
This Lynel bow is made from a special steel
found at the peak of Death Mountain.
It has tremendous stopping power and can
pierce thick armor as easily as thin paper.
WeaponBow.Weapon_Bow_032_PictureBook:
This Lynel bow is made from a special steel
found at the peak of Death Mountain.
It has tremendous stopping power and can
pierce thick armor as easily as thin paper.
WeaponBow.Weapon_Bow_033_Desc:
This prototype Sheikah-made bow was
designed to fight the Great Calamity. Made
with ancient technology, it boasts a high rate
of fire and firepower but has low durability.
WeaponBow.Weapon_Bow_033_PictureBook:
This prototype Sheikah-made bow was
designed to fight the Great Calamity. Made
with ancient technology, it boasts a high rate
of fire and firepower but has low durability.
WeaponBow.Weapon_Bow_035_Desc:
The sturdy metal construction of this bow
offers superior durability, while its lack of
firing quirks makes it quite reliable. Once
favored by the knights at Hyrule Castle.
WeaponBow.Weapon_Bow_035_PictureBook:
The sturdy metal construction of this bow
offers superior durability, while its lack of
firing quirks makes it quite reliable. Once
favored by the knights at Hyrule Castle.
WeaponBow.Weapon_Bow_036_Desc:
In the past, the king of Hyrule presented this
bow to only the most talented archers in the
land. Its combat capabilities are as
impressive as its extravagant design.
WeaponBow.Weapon_Bow_036_PictureBook:
In the past, the king of Hyrule presented this
bow to only the most talented archers in the
land. Its combat capabilities are as
impressive as its extravagant design.
WeaponBow.Weapon_Bow_038_Desc:
This wooden bow may not be the most
reliable for battling monsters, but it is
excellent for hunting small animals.
WeaponBow.Weapon_Bow_038_PictureBook:
This wooden bow may not be the most
reliable for battling monsters, but it is
excellent for hunting small animals.
WeaponBow.Weapon_Bow_040_Desc:
A bow favored by the skilled archers of the
Yiga Clan. It's been engineered to fire two
arrows at once to ensure your target comes
to a swift and none-too-pleasant halt.
WeaponBow.Weapon_Bow_040_PictureBook:
A bow favored by the skilled archers of the
Yiga Clan. It's been engineered to fire two
arrows at once to ensure your target comes
to a swift and none-too-pleasant halt.
WeaponBow.Weapon_Bow_071_Desc:
Princess Zelda gave you this bow and arrow
for the battle with Dark Beast Ganon. When
wielded by the hero, it fires arrows of pure
light strong enough to oppose the Calamity.
WeaponBow.Weapon_Bow_071_PictureBook:
Princess Zelda gave you this bow and arrow
for the battle with Dark Beast Ganon. When
wielded by the hero, it fires arrows of pure
light strong enough to oppose the Calamity.
WeaponBow.Weapon_Bow_072_Desc:
A bow used by the princess who fought the
beasts of twilight alongside the hero. It's said
to contain the spirits of light's power. It fires
arrows straight and true, as if beams of light.

WeaponLargeSword.Weapon_Lsword_001_Desc:
A basic two-handed sword often
wielded by aspiring adventurers.
Its immense weight can knock enemies'
shields right out of their hands.
WeaponLargeSword.Weapon_Lsword_001_PictureBook:
A basic two-handed sword often
wielded by aspiring adventurers.
Its immense weight can knock enemies'
shields right out of their hands.
WeaponLargeSword.Weapon_Lsword_002_Desc:
A two-handed sword designed for combat.
It's heavy and hard to use but has decent
build quality and durability.
WeaponLargeSword.Weapon_Lsword_002_PictureBook:
A two-handed sword designed for combat.
It's heavy and hard to use but has decent
build quality and durability.
WeaponLargeSword.Weapon_Lsword_003_Desc:
Only the most confident of Hyrule Castle's
knights carried this two-handed sword. Its
cutting edge is finely honed.
WeaponLargeSword.Weapon_Lsword_003_PictureBook:
Only the most confident of Hyrule Castle's
knights carried this two-handed sword. Its
cutting edge is finely honed.
WeaponLargeSword.Weapon_Lsword_004_Desc:
A clunky club made by a Bokoblin. If you
swing it at an enemy's shield, it may be
able to knock the shield out of your
foe's hand.
WeaponLargeSword.Weapon_Lsword_004_PictureBook:
A clunky club made by a Bokoblin. If you
swing it at an enemy's shield, it may be
able to knock the shield out of your
foe's hand.
WeaponLargeSword.Weapon_Lsword_005_Desc:
After much consideration by Bokoblins on
how to improve the Boko bat, they simply
attached sharp spikes to it. A skilled fighter
can cause immense damage with this.
WeaponLargeSword.Weapon_Lsword_005_PictureBook:
After much consideration by Bokoblins on
how to improve the Boko bat, they simply
attached sharp spikes to it. A skilled fighter
can cause immense damage with this.
WeaponLargeSword.Weapon_Lsword_006_Desc:
Used by only the toughest Bokoblin warriors,
this Boko bat has been fortified by fossilized
bone. It boasts a high durability and is strong
enough to beat down powerful foes.
WeaponLargeSword.Weapon_Lsword_006_PictureBook:
Used by only the toughest Bokoblin warriors,
this Boko bat has been fortified by fossilized
bone. It boasts a high durability and is strong
enough to beat down powerful foes.
WeaponLargeSword.Weapon_Lsword_010_Desc:
A crudely fashioned club favored by Moblins.
It's carved from a sturdy tree but is sloppily
made, so it breaks easily.
WeaponLargeSword.Weapon_Lsword_010_PictureBook:
A crudely fashioned club favored by Moblins.
It's carved from a sturdy tree but is sloppily
made, so it breaks easily.
WeaponLargeSword.Weapon_Lsword_011_Desc:
Animal bone has been affixed to this
Moblin club to greatly improve its damage.
WeaponLargeSword.Weapon_Lsword_011_PictureBook:
Animal bone has been affixed to this
Moblin club to greatly improve its damage.
WeaponLargeSword.Weapon_Lsword_012_Desc:
The bone of an ancient beast has been
affixed to this Moblin club, further increasing
its damage. Moblins carrying these in battle
are particularly dangerous.
WeaponLargeSword.Weapon_Lsword_012_PictureBook:
The bone of an ancient beast has been
affixed to this Moblin club, further increasing
its damage. Moblins carrying these in battle
are particularly dangerous.
WeaponLargeSword.Weapon_Lsword_013_Desc:
A weapon used by Guardian Scouts.
Its unique blade was forged using ancient
technology. Although powerful, its unusual
shape causes it to break easily.
WeaponLargeSword.Weapon_Lsword_013_PictureBook:
A weapon used by Guardian Scouts.
Its unique blade was forged using ancient
technology. Although powerful, its unusual
shape causes it to break easily.
WeaponLargeSword.Weapon_Lsword_014_Desc:
This ancient battle axe's damage output
has been increased to maximum. It's sharp
enough to cut through almost anything, so
it may have been used to forge new routes.
WeaponLargeSword.Weapon_Lsword_014_PictureBook:
This ancient battle axe's damage output
has been increased to maximum. It's sharp
enough to cut through almost anything, so
it may have been used to forge new routes.
WeaponLargeSword.Weapon_Lsword_015_Desc:
This ancient battle axe's damage output is
scaled up to peak performance. Ancient
technology makes it possible to enhance
cutting power beyond metal weapons' limits.
WeaponLargeSword.Weapon_Lsword_015_PictureBook:
This ancient battle axe's damage output is
scaled up to peak performance. Ancient
technology makes it possible to enhance
cutting power beyond metal weapons' limits.
WeaponLargeSword.Weapon_Lsword_016_Desc:
This two-handed weapon is favored by the
Lynels. It may be more accurate to call it a
lump of metal than a weapon, but if wielded
by a Lynel, it can pound you into a fine dust.
WeaponLargeSword.Weapon_Lsword_016_PictureBook:
This two-handed weapon is favored by the
Lynels. It may be more accurate to call it a
lump of metal than a weapon, but if wielded
by a Lynel, it can pound you into a fine dust.
WeaponLargeSword.Weapon_Lsword_017_Desc:
This Lynel-made two-handed weapon has
been reinforced to increase its durability
and striking power. Its overwhelming heft
will crush your foe, shield and all.
WeaponLargeSword.Weapon_Lsword_017_PictureBook:
This Lynel-made two-handed weapon has
been reinforced to increase its durability
and striking power. Its overwhelming heft
will crush your foe, shield and all.
WeaponLargeSword.Weapon_Lsword_018_Desc:
This Lynel-made two-handed weapon is
immensely heavy thanks to a rare metal
from Death Mountain's peak. The power of
its downward swing is in a class all its own.
WeaponLargeSword.Weapon_Lsword_018_PictureBook:
This Lynel-made two-handed weapon is
immensely heavy thanks to a rare metal
from Death Mountain's peak. The power of
its downward swing is in a class all its own.
WeaponLargeSword.Weapon_Lsword_019_Desc:
A Moblin bone that continues to move even
after being detached from its body. The bone
is thick enough to be used as a weapon but
is extremely brittle and easily broken.
WeaponLargeSword.Weapon_Lsword_019_PictureBook:
A Moblin bone that continues to move even
after being detached from its body. The bone
is thick enough to be used as a weapon but
is extremely brittle and easily broken.
WeaponLargeSword.Weapon_Lsword_020_Desc:
A two-handed sword not properly cared for.
Although it can be used as a weapon, its
durability is very low. Don't expect it to
last for more than a few strikes.
WeaponLargeSword.Weapon_Lsword_020_PictureBook:
A two-handed sword not properly cared for.
Although it can be used as a weapon, its
durability is very low. Don't expect it to
last for more than a few strikes.
WeaponLargeSword.Weapon_Lsword_023_Desc:
This two-handed sword was forged using
ancient Sheikah technology. Its unique
rotating blades give it impressive cutting
power that will slice enemies to shreds.
WeaponLargeSword.Weapon_Lsword_023_PictureBook:
This two-handed sword was forged using
ancient Sheikah technology. Its unique
rotating blades give it impressive cutting
power that will slice enemies to shreds.
WeaponLargeSword.Weapon_Lsword_024_Desc:
A two-handed sword issued to the Hyrulean
royal family's immediate guard detail.
Its powerful strikes are said to crush an
opponent's body and resolve alike.
WeaponLargeSword.Weapon_Lsword_024_PictureBook:
A two-handed sword issued to the Hyrulean
royal family's immediate guard detail.
Its powerful strikes are said to crush an
opponent's body and resolve alike.
WeaponLargeSword.Weapon_Lsword_027_Desc:
Although the Zora prefer spears to swords,
they made this two-handed weapon using
a special metal. It found popularity among
Hylians for its unique design.
WeaponLargeSword.Weapon_Lsword_027_PictureBook:
Although the Zora prefer spears to swords,
they made this two-handed weapon using
a special metal. It found popularity among
Hylians for its unique design.
WeaponLargeSword.Weapon_Lsword_029_Desc:
Only the most talented Gerudo sword fighters
carry this two-handed sword. It's actually
much lighter than it appears and is
surprisingly easy to wield.
WeaponLargeSword.Weapon_Lsword_029_PictureBook:
Only the most talented Gerudo sword fighters
carry this two-handed sword. It's actually
much lighter than it appears and is
surprisingly easy to wield.
WeaponLargeSword.Weapon_Lsword_030_Desc:
This double-sided axe was designed with
fighting in mind. It's a bit unwieldy, so it
requires a well-practiced technique to
use efficiently.
WeaponLargeSword.Weapon_Lsword_030_PictureBook:
This double-sided axe was designed with
fighting in mind. It's a bit unwieldy, so it
requires a well-practiced technique to
use efficiently.
WeaponLargeSword.Weapon_Lsword_031_Desc:
This large iron sledgehammer was originally
used for mining, but it works reasonably well
as a weapon too.
WeaponLargeSword.Weapon_Lsword_031_PictureBook:
This large iron sledgehammer was originally
used for mining, but it works reasonably well
as a weapon too.
WeaponLargeSword.Weapon_Lsword_032_Desc:
A woodcutter's tool of choice for felling trees.
Its formidable weight and uneven balancing
make it a slow, inefficient weapon.
WeaponLargeSword.Weapon_Lsword_032_PictureBook:
A woodcutter's tool of choice for felling trees.
Its formidable weight and uneven balancing
make it a slow, inefficient weapon.
WeaponLargeSword.Weapon_Lsword_033_Desc:
This magic-infused greatsword was forged
in the fires of Death Mountain by Goron
smiths in an ancient age. Attack when the
blade glows red to expel flames.
WeaponLargeSword.Weapon_Lsword_033_PictureBook:
This magic-infused greatsword was forged
in the fires of Death Mountain by Goron
smiths in an ancient age. Attack when the
blade glows red to expel flames.
WeaponLargeSword.Weapon_Lsword_034_Desc:
This magic-infused greatsword was forged
by smelting ore found in the Hebra
Mountains' permafrost. Attack when the
blade glows blue to expel freezing air.
WeaponLargeSword.Weapon_Lsword_034_PictureBook:
This magic-infused greatsword was forged
by smelting ore found in the Hebra
Mountains' permafrost. Attack when the
blade glows blue to expel freezing air.
WeaponLargeSword.Weapon_Lsword_035_Desc:
This magic-infused greatsword was forged
by the Hyrulean royal family using lightning
from the Hyrule Hills. Attack when the blade
glows golden to expel lightning.
WeaponLargeSword.Weapon_Lsword_035_PictureBook:
This magic-infused greatsword was forged
by the Hyrulean royal family using lightning
from the Hyrule Hills. Attack when the blade
glows golden to expel lightning.
WeaponLargeSword.Weapon_Lsword_036_Desc:
A Goron-made two-handed weapon. It's
made from thick, hard metal and has no
cutting edge, so it relies on its sheer
weight to crush all opponents.
WeaponLargeSword.Weapon_Lsword_036_PictureBook:
A Goron-made two-handed weapon. It's
made from thick, hard metal and has no
cutting edge, so it relies on its sheer
weight to crush all opponents.
WeaponLargeSword.Weapon_Lsword_037_Desc:
A two-handed weapon forged from a rare
metal mined in Goron City. Its center of
gravity is at its tip, so it uses centrifugal force
and its sheer weight to smash opponents flat.
WeaponLargeSword.Weapon_Lsword_037_PictureBook:
A two-handed weapon forged from a rare
metal mined in Goron City. Its center of
gravity is at its tip, so it uses centrifugal force
and its sheer weight to smash opponents flat.
WeaponLargeSword.Weapon_Lsword_038_Desc:
Made for paddling boats, but it was made
sturdy enough to fight strong currents.
Maybe it's useful for self-defense in a pinch.
WeaponLargeSword.Weapon_Lsword_038_PictureBook:
Made for paddling boats, but it was made
sturdy enough to fight strong currents.
Maybe it's useful for self-defense in a pinch.
WeaponLargeSword.Weapon_Lsword_041_Desc:
A single-edged sword seldom seen in Hyrule.
This weapon is passed down through the
Sheikah tribe and has an astonishingly
sharp edge ideal for slicing.
WeaponLargeSword.Weapon_Lsword_041_PictureBook:
A single-edged sword seldom seen in Hyrule.
This weapon is passed down through the
Sheikah tribe and has an astonishingly
sharp edge ideal for slicing.
WeaponLargeSword.Weapon_Lsword_045_Desc:
A farming tool primarily used for tilling fields.
Its fine craftsmanship is sturdy enough
to withstand backbreaking fieldwork, but
its battle applications are untested.
WeaponLargeSword.Weapon_Lsword_045_PictureBook:
A farming tool primarily used for tilling fields.
Its fine craftsmanship is sturdy enough
to withstand backbreaking fieldwork, but
its battle applications are untested.
WeaponLargeSword.Weapon_Lsword_047_Desc:
The Sheikah used the very essence of
ancient technology to forge this greatsword.
It was designed to oppose the Calamity, but
its low durability made it impractical in battle.
WeaponLargeSword.Weapon_Lsword_047_PictureBook:
The Sheikah used the very essence of
ancient technology to forge this greatsword.
It was designed to oppose the Calamity, but
its low durability made it impractical in battle.
WeaponLargeSword.Weapon_Lsword_051_Desc:
This massive boomerang requires two hands.
Originally used for hunting, it was modified
for use as a weapon. The blades on the
inner curves make it a bit tricky to wield.
WeaponLargeSword.Weapon_Lsword_051_PictureBook:
This massive boomerang requires two hands.
Originally used for hunting, it was modified
for use as a weapon. The blades on the
inner curves make it a bit tricky to wield.
WeaponLargeSword.Weapon_Lsword_054_Desc:
This two-handed weapon was once wielded
by the Goron Champion Daruk. Daruk made
swinging it around look easy, but a Hylian
would need an immense amount of strength.
WeaponLargeSword.Weapon_Lsword_054_PictureBook:
This two-handed weapon was once wielded
by the Goron Champion Daruk. Daruk made
swinging it around look easy, but a Hylian
would need an immense amount of strength.
WeaponLargeSword.Weapon_Lsword_055_Desc:
A curious double-edged sword crafted using
Sheikah technology. It was originally made
for Hyrulean knights unfamiliar with single-
edged blades.
WeaponLargeSword.Weapon_Lsword_055_PictureBook:
A curious double-edged sword crafted using
Sheikah technology. It was originally made
for Hyrulean knights unfamiliar with single-
edged blades.
WeaponLargeSword.Weapon_Lsword_056_Desc:
A single swing of this giant, sturdy leaf can
create a gust of wind strong enough to blow
away light objects. These will sometimes fall
off trees as they're chopped down.
WeaponLargeSword.Weapon_Lsword_056_PictureBook:
A single swing of this giant, sturdy leaf can
create a gust of wind strong enough to blow
away light objects. These will sometimes fall
off trees as they're chopped down.
WeaponLargeSword.Weapon_Lsword_057_Desc:
The Six Sages are said to have forged this
longsword to seal a demon king in the world
where the hero fought against the beasts of
twilight. The blade shines with a holy luster.
WeaponLargeSword.Weapon_Lsword_059_Desc:
A legendary greatsword forged by a Goron
craftsman for a hero who traveled through
time. The exceptionally sharp cutting edge
is a testament to the craftsman's mastery.
WeaponLargeSword.Weapon_Lsword_060_Desc:
A peculiar greatsword allegedly used by a
hero from a world in which the moon
threatened to fall. It slashes wildly in battle
as if possessed by a fierce deity.
WeaponLargeSword.Weapon_Lsword_074_Desc:
This sword is favored by high-ranking
members of the Yiga. When wielded by a
proficient fighter, its unique shape cleaves
the very wind and creates a vacuum.
WeaponLargeSword.Weapon_Lsword_074_PictureBook:
This sword is favored by high-ranking
members of the Yiga. When wielded by a
proficient fighter, its unique shape cleaves
the very wind and creates a vacuum.

WeaponShield.Weapon_Shield_001_Desc:
This lightweight, simple shield is ideal for
less-experienced fighters. It can withstand
light attacks, but blocking stronger blows
is not recommended.
WeaponShield.Weapon_Shield_001_PictureBook:
This lightweight, simple shield is ideal for
less-experienced fighters. It can withstand
light attacks, but blocking stronger blows
is not recommended.
WeaponShield.Weapon_Shield_002_Desc:
A shield once used by the guards of Hyrule
Castle. It's easy to handle, but its core is 
made of wood, so it can catch fire.
WeaponShield.Weapon_Shield_002_PictureBook:
A shield once used by the guards of Hyrule
Castle. It's easy to handle, but its core is 
made of wood, so it can catch fire.
WeaponShield.Weapon_Shield_003_Desc:
A shield favored by the knights who served
the Hyrulean royal family. Its sturdy metal
construction makes it quite durable, but
its weight requires decent skill to wield.
WeaponShield.Weapon_Shield_003_PictureBook:
A shield favored by the knights who served
the Hyrulean royal family. Its sturdy metal
construction makes it quite durable, but
its weight requires decent skill to wield.
WeaponShield.Weapon_Shield_004_Desc:
A Bokoblin-made shield created by attaching
a handhold to any flat tree bark picked up
off the ground. It's pretty shoddy, so don't
expect it to last very long.
WeaponShield.Weapon_Shield_004_PictureBook:
A Bokoblin-made shield created by attaching
a handhold to any flat tree bark picked up
off the ground. It's pretty shoddy, so don't
expect it to last very long.
WeaponShield.Weapon_Shield_005_Desc:
A Boko shield made of slightly stronger
wood and reinforced with animal bones.
WeaponShield.Weapon_Shield_005_PictureBook:
A Boko shield made of slightly stronger
wood and reinforced with animal bones.
WeaponShield.Weapon_Shield_006_Desc:
This Boko shield is reinforced with fossilized
bone. Its defensive capabilities are
respectable, but its predictably slipshod
craftsmanship spells low durability.
WeaponShield.Weapon_Shield_006_PictureBook:
This Boko shield is reinforced with fossilized
bone. Its defensive capabilities are
respectable, but its predictably slipshod
craftsmanship spells low durability.
WeaponShield.Weapon_Shield_007_Desc:
A common shield found among the Lizalfos.
It's made of metal, but its sloppy
craftsmanship offers poor durability.
WeaponShield.Weapon_Shield_007_PictureBook:
A common shield found among the Lizalfos.
It's made of metal, but its sloppy
craftsmanship offers poor durability.
WeaponShield.Weapon_Shield_008_Desc:
This Lizal shield has been strengthened by
adding a different type of metal to the mix.
The edge is lined with spikes, so handle
with care.
WeaponShield.Weapon_Shield_008_PictureBook:
This Lizal shield has been strengthened by
adding a different type of metal to the mix.
The edge is lined with spikes, so handle
with care.
WeaponShield.Weapon_Shield_009_Desc:
This Lizal shield is adorned with several
metal shells as a means of reinforcement.
Its defensive capabilities are high, but its
weight requires a skilled soldier to bear.
WeaponShield.Weapon_Shield_009_PictureBook:
This Lizal shield is adorned with several
metal shells as a means of reinforcement.
Its defensive capabilities are high, but its
weight requires a skilled soldier to bear.
WeaponShield.Weapon_Shield_013_Desc:
A shield made with ancient Sheikah
technology. It can deflect a Guardian
Scout's beam.
WeaponShield.Weapon_Shield_013_PictureBook:
A shield made with ancient Sheikah
technology. It can deflect a Guardian
Scout's beam.
WeaponShield.Weapon_Shield_014_Desc:
This larger version of a Guardian shield
has had its output level boosted. Its
defensive capabilities are comparable to
those of a metal shield's.
WeaponShield.Weapon_Shield_014_PictureBook:
This larger version of a Guardian shield
has had its output level boosted. Its
defensive capabilities are comparable to
those of a metal shield's.
WeaponShield.Weapon_Shield_015_Desc:
The output level of this shield has been
boosted to maximum. Its combat capabilities
surpass those of metallic shields, and it
can deflect Guardian Scout beams.
WeaponShield.Weapon_Shield_015_PictureBook:
The output level of this shield has been
boosted to maximum. Its combat capabilities
surpass those of metallic shields, and it
can deflect Guardian Scout beams.
WeaponShield.Weapon_Shield_016_Desc:
A sturdy shield favored by Lynels for its
defensive and offensive capabilities. First
and foremost a shield, but the bladed edges
can deal slashing attacks when deflecting.
WeaponShield.Weapon_Shield_016_PictureBook:
A sturdy shield favored by Lynels for its
defensive and offensive capabilities. First
and foremost a shield, but the bladed edges
can deal slashing attacks when deflecting.
WeaponShield.Weapon_Shield_017_Desc:
This Lynel-made shield has been reinforced
with armor and even more blades. Stronger
in both defense and offense, it can tear
through basic armor when deflecting.
WeaponShield.Weapon_Shield_017_PictureBook:
This Lynel-made shield has been reinforced
with armor and even more blades. Stronger
in both defense and offense, it can tear
through basic armor when deflecting.
WeaponShield.Weapon_Shield_018_Desc:
This ultimate Lynel shield is used only by the
white-haired Lynels. It excels at defending
against even the most brutal of attacks and
cutting down powerful foes when deflecting.
WeaponShield.Weapon_Shield_018_PictureBook:
This ultimate Lynel shield is used only by the
white-haired Lynels. It excels at defending
against even the most brutal of attacks and
cutting down powerful foes when deflecting.
WeaponShield.Weapon_Shield_021_Desc:
It's likely this rusty old shield once belonged
to a knight. It still has some defensive
capabilities, but its usefulness has been
worn down by time.
WeaponShield.Weapon_Shield_021_PictureBook:
It's likely this rusty old shield once belonged
to a knight. It still has some defensive
capabilities, but its usefulness has been
worn down by time.
WeaponShield.Weapon_Shield_022_Desc:
A shield issued to the Hyrulean royal
family's immediate guard detail. It boasts a
high defense, but these days it's more a
collector's item due to its ornamentation.
WeaponShield.Weapon_Shield_022_PictureBook:
A shield issued to the Hyrulean royal
family's immediate guard detail. It boasts a
high defense, but these days it's more a
collector's item due to its ornamentation.
WeaponShield.Weapon_Shield_023_Desc:
The Koroks made this shield specifically for
Hylians. It's made from the finest hard wood
of trees that grow only in the Korok forest, so
it's sturdier than it looks.
WeaponShield.Weapon_Shield_023_PictureBook:
The Koroks made this shield specifically for
Hylians. It's made from the finest hard wood
of trees that grow only in the Korok forest, so
it's sturdier than it looks.
WeaponShield.Weapon_Shield_025_Desc:
A Zora-made shield adorned with intricate
ornamentation. It's said that true masters
of this shield can redirect attacks as a rock
redirects rushing water.
WeaponShield.Weapon_Shield_025_PictureBook:
A Zora-made shield adorned with intricate
ornamentation. It's said that true masters
of this shield can redirect attacks as a rock
redirects rushing water.
WeaponShield.Weapon_Shield_026_Desc:
The design of this metal shield has changed
over time to match the Gerudo's sword-and-
shield fighting style. It's favored by soldiers
and travelers alike.
WeaponShield.Weapon_Shield_026_PictureBook:
The design of this metal shield has changed
over time to match the Gerudo's sword-and-
shield fighting style. It's favored by soldiers
and travelers alike.
WeaponShield.Weapon_Shield_030_Desc:
A shield passed down through the Hyrulean
royal family, along with the legend of the
hero who wielded it. Its defensive capabilities
and durability outshine all other shields.
WeaponShield.Weapon_Shield_030_PictureBook:
A shield passed down through the Hyrulean
royal family, along with the legend of the
hero who wielded it. Its defensive capabilities
and durability outshine all other shields.
WeaponShield.Weapon_Shield_031_Desc:
Favored by hunters for its rabbit design,
which is said to bring luck on hunts. It's
easy to use, but its durability leaves
something to be desired.
WeaponShield.Weapon_Shield_031_PictureBook:
Favored by hunters for its rabbit design,
which is said to bring luck on hunts. It's
easy to use, but its durability leaves
something to be desired.
WeaponShield.Weapon_Shield_032_Desc:
Often carried by fishermen for its fish design,
which represents hope for a great catch. Its
light wooden construction makes it
convenient to take onto a boat.
WeaponShield.Weapon_Shield_032_PictureBook:
Often carried by fishermen for its fish design,
which represents hope for a great catch. Its
light wooden construction makes it
convenient to take onto a boat.
WeaponShield.Weapon_Shield_033_Desc:
This shield was forged using ancient Sheikah
technology. It boasts extremely high stopping
power, but its structural weakness made its
low durability impractical for combat.
WeaponShield.Weapon_Shield_033_PictureBook:
This shield was forged using ancient Sheikah
technology. It boasts extremely high stopping
power, but its structural weakness made its
low durability impractical for combat.
WeaponShield.Weapon_Shield_034_Desc:
This shield features a traditional design from
Necluda. Its combat capabilities aren't much
better than the standard wooden shield, but
it found popularity for its design.
WeaponShield.Weapon_Shield_034_PictureBook:
This shield features a traditional design from
Necluda. Its combat capabilities aren't much
better than the standard wooden shield, but
it found popularity for its design.
WeaponShield.Weapon_Shield_035_Desc:
A sturdy shield loved by many an adventurer.
It is made of animal hide and sturdy wood
and is best suited to defending against weak
monsters or animals.
WeaponShield.Weapon_Shield_035_PictureBook:
A sturdy shield loved by many an adventurer.
It is made of animal hide and sturdy wood
and is best suited to defending against weak
monsters or animals.
WeaponShield.Weapon_Shield_036_Desc:
This extravagant shield is presented to
Gerudo warriors who rise to the rank of
captain. Its apparent opulence is rivaled
only by its combat capabilities.
WeaponShield.Weapon_Shield_036_PictureBook:
This extravagant shield is presented to
Gerudo warriors who rise to the rank of
captain. Its apparent opulence is rivaled
only by its combat capabilities.
WeaponShield.Weapon_Shield_037_Desc:
This shield was cherished by the Gerudo
Champion Urbosa. The gold used to make it
was handpicked to ensure a design that is
both lightweight and very durable.
WeaponShield.Weapon_Shield_037_PictureBook:
This shield was cherished by the Gerudo
Champion Urbosa. The gold used to make it
was handpicked to ensure a design that is
both lightweight and very durable.
WeaponShield.Weapon_Shield_038_Desc:
This shield was made using ancient Sheikah
technology. Its surface glows blue when
raised in defense. Enhanced functionality
allows it to deflect Guardian beams.
WeaponShield.Weapon_Shield_038_PictureBook:
This shield was made using ancient Sheikah
technology. Its surface glows blue when
raised in defense. Enhanced functionality
allows it to deflect Guardian beams.
WeaponShield.Weapon_Shield_040_Desc:
The lid of a large soup pot. It smells vaguely
of poultry broth... Yum! It can take quite a
beating before breaking.
WeaponShield.Weapon_Shield_040_PictureBook:
The lid of a large soup pot. It smells vaguely
of poultry broth... Yum! It can take quite a
beating before breaking.
WeaponShield.Weapon_Shield_041_Desc:
A small Sheikah-made shield. Its design is
intended to decrease blind spots without
sacrificing too much defense.
WeaponShield.Weapon_Shield_041_PictureBook:
A small Sheikah-made shield. Its design is
intended to decrease blind spots without
sacrificing too much defense.
WeaponShield.Weapon_Shield_042_Desc:
Rito warriors cherish this shield. Its unique
shape is designed with mid-battle flight in
mind to facilitate aerial combat.
WeaponShield.Weapon_Shield_042_PictureBook:
Rito warriors cherish this shield. Its unique
shape is designed with mid-battle flight in
mind to facilitate aerial combat.
WeaponShield.Weapon_Shield_057_Desc:
A shield said to have been the favorite of a
hero who traveled the open seas. It was
apparently a family heirloom, passed down
through many generations.

WeaponSmallSword.Weapon_Sword_001_Desc:
A very common sword often kept by travelers
to fend off small beasts. It's fairly durable
but a bit unreliable against monsters.
WeaponSmallSword.Weapon_Sword_001_PictureBook:
A very common sword often kept by travelers
to fend off small beasts. It's fairly durable,
but a bit unreliable against monsters.
WeaponSmallSword.Weapon_Sword_002_Desc:
A sword brandished by the soldiers who
once protected Hyrule Castle. Its durable
blade is well tuned for slaying monsters.
WeaponSmallSword.Weapon_Sword_002_PictureBook:
A sword brandished by the soldiers who
once protected Hyrule Castle. Its durable
blade is well tuned for slaying monsters.
WeaponSmallSword.Weapon_Sword_003_Desc:
Knights of Hyrule once carried this sword.
These days it's the weapon of choice for
seasoned adventurers thanks to its ease
of use and high attack power.
WeaponSmallSword.Weapon_Sword_003_PictureBook:
Knights of Hyrule once carried this sword.
These days it's the weapon of choice for
seasoned adventurers thanks to its ease
of use and high attack power.
WeaponSmallSword.Weapon_Sword_004_Desc:
A crude Bokoblin club made to clobber small
prey. It's essentially a stick, so its durability
is low.
WeaponSmallSword.Weapon_Sword_004_PictureBook:
A crude Bokoblin club made to clobber small
prey. It's essentially a stick, so its durability
is low.
WeaponSmallSword.Weapon_Sword_005_Desc:
A reinforced Bokoblin club made to maximize
damage. The sharpened bones jabbed into it
make it a brutal weapon.
WeaponSmallSword.Weapon_Sword_005_PictureBook:
A reinforced Bokoblin club made to maximize
damage. The sharpened bones jabbed into it
make it a brutal weapon.
WeaponSmallSword.Weapon_Sword_006_Desc:
This Bokoblin club has been reinforced with
fossilized bones to maximize clobbering
potential. Only the brawniest of Bokoblins
can manage its immense weight.
WeaponSmallSword.Weapon_Sword_006_PictureBook:
This Bokoblin club has been reinforced with
fossilized bones to maximize clobbering
potential. Only the brawniest of Bokoblins
can manage its immense weight.
WeaponSmallSword.Weapon_Sword_007_Desc:
A curved sword favored by the Lizalfos.
It can be used to attack directly or can
be thrown like a boomerang.
WeaponSmallSword.Weapon_Sword_007_PictureBook:
A curved sword favored by the Lizalfos.
It can be used to attack directly or can
be thrown like a boomerang.
WeaponSmallSword.Weapon_Sword_008_Desc:
Blue Lizalfos in particular like this weapon.
It has one more blade than the
Lizal boomerang to give it additional cutting
power, and it still returns when thrown.
WeaponSmallSword.Weapon_Sword_008_PictureBook:
Blue Lizalfos in particular like this weapon.
It has one more blade than the
Lizal boomerang to give it additional cutting
power, and it still returns when thrown.
WeaponSmallSword.Weapon_Sword_009_Desc:
More blades means more attack power!
It can be used as a boomerang, but all those
blades makes that a bit more dangerous.
Carried by Black Lizalfos seasoned in battle.
WeaponSmallSword.Weapon_Sword_009_PictureBook:
More blades means more attack power!
It can be used as a boomerang, but all those
blades makes that a bit more dangerous.
Carried by Black Lizalfos seasoned in battle.
WeaponSmallSword.Weapon_Sword_013_Desc:
A sword often wielded by Guardian Scouts.
Its blue energy blade is a product of ancient
technology. It's not very durable.
WeaponSmallSword.Weapon_Sword_013_PictureBook:
A sword often wielded by Guardian Scouts.
Its blue energy blade is a product of ancient
technology. It's not very durable.
WeaponSmallSword.Weapon_Sword_014_Desc:
This Guardian sword has enhanced power
over the standard model. Its cutting
capabilities are improved, and its durability
has seen a slight uptick.
WeaponSmallSword.Weapon_Sword_014_PictureBook:
This Guardian sword has enhanced power
over the standard model. Its cutting
capabilities are improved, and its durability
has seen a slight uptick.
WeaponSmallSword.Weapon_Sword_015_Desc:
The abilities of this Guardian sword have
been boosted to the maximum, as evidenced
by its increase in size. It slices through
armor like a hot knife through butter!
WeaponSmallSword.Weapon_Sword_015_PictureBook:
The abilities of this Guardian sword have
been boosted to the maximum, as evidenced
by its increase in size. It slices through
armor like a hot knife through butter!
WeaponSmallSword.Weapon_Sword_016_Desc:
This Lynel-made sword was designed with
smashing in mind rather than slicing. It's
on the heavy side compared to what Hylians
are used to, but it's very strong.
WeaponSmallSword.Weapon_Sword_016_PictureBook:
This Lynel-made sword was designed with
smashing in mind rather than slicing. It's
on the heavy side compared to what Hylians
are used to, but it's very strong.
WeaponSmallSword.Weapon_Sword_017_Desc:
This Lynel-made sword boasts more blades
and more attack power. A skilled Lynel can
draw this sword simply in passing and still
cut a foe in two.
WeaponSmallSword.Weapon_Sword_017_PictureBook:
This Lynel-made sword boasts more blades
and more attack power. A skilled Lynel can
draw this sword simply in passing and still
cut a foe in two.
WeaponSmallSword.Weapon_Sword_018_Desc:
A brutal sword carried by white-haired
Lynels. The savage blades are strong
enough to cut down any foe, no matter how
strong.
WeaponSmallSword.Weapon_Sword_018_PictureBook:
A brutal sword carried by white-haired
Lynels. The savage blades are strong
enough to cut down any foe, no matter how
strong.
WeaponSmallSword.Weapon_Sword_019_Desc:
A skeletal arm that keeps moving even after
its severed from its body. It's kind of gross to
strap it to your back, but it'll do in a pinch.
It's old and fragile, so it's quick to break.
WeaponSmallSword.Weapon_Sword_019_PictureBook:
A skeletal arm that keeps moving even after
its severed from its body. It's kind of gross to
strap it to your back, but it'll do in a pinch.
It's old and fragile, so it's quick to break.
WeaponSmallSword.Weapon_Sword_020_Desc:
The arm of a Stalizalfos that continues to
struggle even in death. It can be used as a
weapon, but it's very brittle. You can feel it
wiggling when you strap it to your back...
WeaponSmallSword.Weapon_Sword_020_PictureBook:
The arm of a Stalizalfos that continues to
struggle even in death. It can be used as a
weapon, but it's very brittle. You can feel it
wiggling when you strap it to your back...
WeaponSmallSword.Weapon_Sword_021_Desc:
This once-fearsome sword has seen better
days. It can do some damage in the right
hands but also breaks quickly.
WeaponSmallSword.Weapon_Sword_021_PictureBook:
This once-fearsome sword has seen better
days. It can do some damage in the right
hands but also breaks quickly.
WeaponSmallSword.Weapon_Sword_022_Desc:
A kitchen implement often used for serving
delicious soups. It was carved from the wood
of a sturdy tree, so it actually packs quite
the wallop.
WeaponSmallSword.Weapon_Sword_022_PictureBook:
A kitchen implement often used for serving
delicious soups. It was carved from the wood
of a sturdy tree, so it actually packs quite
the wallop.
WeaponSmallSword.Weapon_Sword_023_Desc:
The blade of this sword was made using an
ancient power lost to this modern age. Its
blade appears only when drawn, and its
cutting power surpasses metal swords.
WeaponSmallSword.Weapon_Sword_023_PictureBook:
The blade of this sword was made using an
ancient power lost to this modern age. Its
blade appears only when drawn, and its
cutting power surpasses metal swords.
WeaponSmallSword.Weapon_Sword_024_Desc:
The Hyrulean royal family would award this
sword to knights who achieved remarkable
feats. A sword that balances strength and
beauty as elegantly as this one is a rare find.
WeaponSmallSword.Weapon_Sword_024_PictureBook:
The Hyrulean royal family would award this
sword to knights who achieved remarkable
